neighborhood_overview: Live like a local in the United State's "coolest neighborhood" Ukrainian Village West Town neighborhood of Chicago! Hipster heaven with an abundance of wallet friendly ethnic and local restaurants, bars and eclectic shopping!
notes: Yoga, medical interns and advanced degree students welcome. Not a party house, please! NO THIRD PARTY BOOKINGS, Keys only provided to registered guests, all guests must be approved and registered on Airbnb.
transit: 2 or 4 block walk to CTA buslines, #66 and #65 to downtown and also connect to the "blue line" train. The Metra train is an 8 minute express to Union station. Hourly car rental, Divvy bike share stations abound. Ample and free street parking. Options from Midway or O'Hare airport is either cab/Uber $35, CTA ($5 from O'Hare, $2.50 from Midway) to Western Avenue train stops. Buy your monthly/weekly transportation pass at the airport vending machine or in advance via Ventra website. Avis only $9.95 + tax US for one way to/from city.  Host can give transportation details upon request.  Easy and free street parking in front of apartment. Cafes. restaurants, grocery 4 blocks away or less.
access: Help yourself to whatever food is in the pantry, FREE laundry in the shared basement, FREE Wifi, free tennis rackets, yoga mats, camping chairs and coolers. FREE local Museum passes may be checked out with owner on a first come first served basis.  Private front porch. Owner has some personal cabinets that are off limits. Bikes can be stored in the basement or enclosed back porch.
interaction: Initial welcome orientation provided with keys.  Keys only provided to registered guest. Owner lives on site in separate apartment. Owner is always accessible by email and text. Extra attention is given to first time visitors to Chicago, and maps will be supplied.
house_rules: My house is your house, but no smoking, candles or loud parties. No unregistered guests without prior host approval. Keys provided only to registered guests. NO THIRD PARTY BOOKINGS.  Please turn off appliances, heat, a/c, fans and lights and lock doors and windows when you leave the house. Let the owner know immediately of any maintenance requests.  Please use cutting boards, not the countertops, and don't rearrange furniture.  Be good to the house and the house will be good to you!
host_about:
Hi, I look forward to meeting you! 
***Update: please note that after years of hosting amazing, incredible people, I had my first unfortunate group of guests who turned my home into a party house, disturbed the neighbors and damaged my possessions. Fortunately, airbnb mediated the claim. In retaliation, the guest posted my one and only negative review.  Please be assured there are no issues with the cable and internet! ***
I'm an entrepreneur, world traveler, foodie, yoga fan but don't do it as much as I should, collegiate fencer, Australian Shepherd Frisbee Champion Trainer, Italy Enthusiast, and love sailing on the waters of beautiful lake Michigan. I'm a low key, drama free individual, and will give you your private independent space, but am there to help you with any questions to make your stay more comfortable!

name: Trendy Roscoe Village 3BR/2BR walk to shops
summary: Awesome 3 bedroom/2 bathroom in one of Chicago's top neighborhoods.  Trendy boutiques, outdoor cafes, and great restaurants and bars.  Very family friendly neighborhood with plenty to do with family and friends!
space: Welcome To Roscoe Village Guesthouse Located in the Heart of Roscoe Village--"A village within the city."   Our Guesthouse is located above Cinnamon Boutique, a new women's clothing and accessory store and one of many fantastic places to shop in the village.   We are located a short distance from Wrigley Field (1.3 miles). Catch a free shuttle 4 blocks away or take a short taxi ride to Wrigley Field and experience all the excitement of the Chicago Cubs! Our rehabbed and fully furnished unit has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and sleeps 8. Each room has a queen sized bed and the living room has a sleeper sofa. Amenities include: * Quality linens  * Flat screen plasma TV * 2 Full baths, plush towels, and toiletries  * Fully equipped kitchen with granite and stainless steel appliances * Hardwood floors and fireplace * Deck * Access to landscaped backyard with built-in bar and grill * Garage parking available for additional charge

summary: Did you know stays over 30 days have significantly lower fees added?  Long time SUPER HOST--PLEASE send a message before making a booking request! space: ACCOMMODATIONS: 2 bedroom flat perfect for short + long term stays. This main floor apartment includes the following amenities: Two comfortable bedrooms with double beds, clean bedding and soft lights for reading *Fully furnished eat-in kitchen is large and equipped with full stove, as well as wide array of cooking implements. This beautiful three story Victorian house was built in 1885, in the heart of Ukrainian village/West town, one of the oldest neighborhoods in the great city of Chicago. NOTE: *Please check availability before booking--We book through several sites and want to make sure it's
neighborhood_overview: NEIGHBORHOOD: This beautiful three story Victorian house was built in 1885, in the heart of Ukrainian village/West town, one of the oldest neighborhoods in the great city of Chicago.  This is a popular and safe neighborhood, with alot of young people, as well as little church going ladies and street food carts, local businesses.  Walk to small or larger grocery store, mexican, thai, pan-american, mexican-french restaurants, a great pie shop, mexican bakery, wonderful coffee and sandwich joints, boutique shopping and that's just Chicago Avenue. Walk four blocks and you're on lively Division Street and the list starts all over again! Spend some time in the fabulous Ukrainian Village, Chicago's 1st Ward
notes: No unregistered overnight guests without prior host approval, photo ID must be shown upon arrival. turn off lights and  lock the doors and windows when you leave the house. Please recycle (check the pamphlet in the apartment for Chicago rules on recycling) Check out is 11 am.  We want you to have fun and enjoy your stay, and respect the property and guests in the other apartments in the house.
transit: You are seconds to Chicago Avenue and CTA transportation that runs all the time to give you easy access to downtown in 15 minutes and anywhere else you want to go in the city. Shared Ride available in minutes. Walk to grocery, restaurants, parks, bars, and boutiques all within blocks. It's a great walking neighborhood!
access: *Fully furnished eat-in kitchen is large and equipped with full stove, as well as wide array of cooking implements *Wireless WI-FI-- Please note: This is a vintage building with good, strong Wi-Fi. It is not an office environment, so if you are plugging in multiple devices and streaming and running video, please do not expect lightening speeds. The house is serviced by ATT and is as fast as the neighborhood has!
interaction: Owner lives on the premises (not in the apartment), but you are on your own, unless you need something. Complete privacy!
house_rules: Fresh towels and linens are provided. Strip the beds when you depart, and hang wet towels in the bathroom to dry. Please turn off appliances, heat, fans and lights when you are away from the house.  Clean up your own messes and dishes, take out all trash, leave the house as it was when you arrived, as if you stayed with your favorite friend or relative. No pets and no smoking anywhere on the premises! Thank you and enjoy your stay
host_about:
Artist and Teacher, landlord, home owner, optimist, living the good life!
Born in Texas, lived in Toronto, Paris, and Austin, + have traveled extensively and have friends visiting from all over the world.  The best experiences of my life were the unexpected surprises of new people in new places, including trips to Zimbabwe and Macedonia for an artists' residency.

I believe in a life well lived, and am open to the adventure of new people passing through.

neighborhood_overview: Since the 1970s, Albany Park has been a point of entry for immigrants from Asia and Latin America and is one of the most ethnically diverse in the United States. It has one of highest percentages of foreign-born residents of neighborhoods in Chicago. As one of Chicago's most ethnically diverse neighborhoods, it boasts an unmatched array of multicultural restaurants, including local favorite Noon-O-Kabab and the celebrated falafel of Semiramis. Along the Lawrence Avenue corridor, you will discover independently-owned grocery stores, delicious Korean cuisine and a collection of highly regarded Middle Eastern and Mexican restaurants. But Albany Park is more than delicious Pad Thai and perfectly roasted kabobs. This charming community vaunts year-round musical and stage performances by the Albany Park Theater Project.
notes: Parking is free on Montrose. Or a space can be rented in the private lot in the back of the building for $10/night. If interested to rent parking space, payment will be collected at check in. This unit is ten steps lower level.
transit: Uber & Lyft apps are very easy to use in Chicago. Bus stop steps from the front door. Blue line train station 15 minutes walk.  About a 20 minute drive to Chicago O'Hare International Airport.
access: Apartment access at front door on Montrose.
interaction: I live 20 minutes away from the property and I am available by phone or text as needed during the stay.
house_rules: No smoking please I encourage guests to remove shoes inside the apartment. Please treat the property as your own Remove trash from the apartment daily. There is a trash can in the back by the iron fence. Keep clean at all times.
host_about: I am a licensed Real Estate Broker in the state of Illinois.

summary: This was a single-family listing, but now is just one bedroom in the home. Lots of natural light, open floorplan.  Perfect kitchen for preparing meals and entertaining.
space: Welcome to my private oasis in Chicago!  This house was renovated  and everything is new! Your bedroom has a full-size bed, desk, large closet,  vaulted ceiling's, and ceiling fan.  There is a private bathroom for you to use just outside of the bedroom door.  A washing machine and dryer is also available next to the bedroom for your use.  I live in the home with my 3 year old so there are plenty of toys, games, and baby items if you need them. There is a pack and play, highchair, stroller if needed. There are hardwood floors throughout the house, and everything is decorated very neutral.  There is a large flat screen TV in the living room with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Sling TV, HBO now, STARZ and Showtime. Also a blueray player, and there are built in surround sound speakers in the ceiling of the first floor.  There is a great gas fireplace that just requires the flip of the switch. notes: We occasionally will watch a small to medium size dog.  The dog would not ever be in your personal bedroom or space, but in the common areas.
interaction: Staying in our home, we will try to incorporate you as much as you wish into our family activities.  Some of our guests like to cook and dine with us, while others prefer to eat alone.  We respect whichever you choose, but always want you to know you are welcome to hang out with our little family.
house_rules: The Rules of the house are simple.  Treat it with respect and treat it like its your own.  No smoking in the house, no illegal drugs, and please clean up after yourself. :)  If you break something please replace it or let me know.
host_about:
Hello! My name is Julie.   Welcome to my airbnb page for my home.  I built this home a couple of years ago and have loved every second of designing it.  This last year my work gave me the opportunity to work on a project in Amsterdam and I decided to rent my home on airbnb while I'm away enjoying my new European lifestyle! Since I used to normally live in the home full time, there is everything you can possibly need from pots/pans to spices, towels, linens, etc.   

I am looking for renters that can care about my home as much as I do, which means to treat it with respect.  If you are in Chicago, it's probably for a vacation and I expect you to have fun, just please do it responsibly.    

If you are interested in renting my home please remember it is a 3 night minimum.  I will not rent to those who have not filled out alll of their verifications so please remember to do so.   I'm sure you will love my home as much as I do.  Please feel free to reach out ot me with any questions you may have about the property.

Thanks!

name: Best Airbnb in Chicago
summary: The most popular Airbnb in Illinois (Buzzfeed, Aug. 2017). After 8 years hosting we still enjoy making our space a special place…as one reviewer commented, "The pictures don't really do justice to how beautiful the apartment is. I will miss having my morning coffee while overlooking the tranquil garden."
space: –  Located in trendy Logan Square and walking distance to Chicago's best restaurants and bars – Conveniently located on the blue line making travel between O'hare and downtown fast and easy – Easy transport to Millennium Park and The Art Institute of Chicago –  Plenty of free street parking –  Beautiful tropical garden and deck for relaxing As one of the first hosts in Chicago, we have experience ensuring your stay is 5-star. Our brick 2-flat is tastefully decorated and has everything you need for your visit. We live upstairs in a separate unit and are available to help with questions about restaurants, the area, and getting around Chicago. You will have access to a lovely deck that overlooks our beautiful yard (yard is shared).

neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the unique green spaces at the heart of Chicago’s historic boulevard system. Logan Square is urban yet tranquil, and home to the city’s best restaurants and nightlife. The apartment is surrounded by easy transit, hip restaurants and cafes.
notes: We are very family friendly and we love hosting kids. We have some gear you can borrow while here, including a pack n' play (portable crib), a countertop high chair (sassy seat), and toys/books galore.
transit: We are a 5 minute walk to the Blue LIne, which runs between O'hare (20 min) and the Loop (15 min), where you can walk to the main tourist attractions such as Millenium Park, the Magnificent Mile and the Museum campus. There are also bus lines running east allowing easy access to the Lakefront and the Red Line (for trips to Wrigley Field or elsewhere).
access: – wireless internet is always available – we provide coffee/tea/creamer – street parking is safe and easy – the apartment has 2 bedrooms (1 queen bed and 2 twins) – an air mattress is available for a 5th person – full size kitchen is stocked with all the tools needed for cooking – sheets and towels provided – basic toiletries and hair dryer provided – bike storage available
interaction: We enjoy meeting our guests and welcome as little or much interaction as you like. I try to be home when you arrive, but if I can't, the door opens with a code. You might see us on the back stairs coming and going, but your apartment is completely private and separate from ours. We have a toy poodle that you might see on the stairs or in the yard.
house_rules: We require a filled out your profile if you are booking instantly, including a profile photo. We live upstairs and like to know who is staying with us. We now allow small pets for an additional fee, but PLEASE email me for an ok before you book since we cannot accommodate all animals. The apartment is completely private, but we live upstairs and I do attempt to meet all our guests at some point, if only to say hello.  We use code for easy access, not keys. For security reasons I can only send the code to the person booking.  Absolutely NO parties or events. Many of our guests invite a couple friends or family over for drinks or dinner, and we encourage that, but larger events and parties are not allowed. We do not allow booking for others. We like to have communication with the person actually staying in the apartment.  Check in: 2pm. You are welcome to drop your bags if you arrive in town earlier, or store them here for later pick-up.  Check out: 11am. You are welcome to leave your ba
host_about: I have a small family (partner, Dave and daughter, Frances, 16) and a passion for nature and travel. I prefer a small cafe to a trendy restaurant, and like to spend my free time hiking, biking and gardening (ok, Dave is the gardener). I spent big chunks of my '20s and '30s in Europe, Asia, Africa and the Middle East, but travel is harder these days with a school schedule so I have been exploring the States, Mexico and South America little by little.

summary: Spectacular vintage greystone located on historical Hoyne ave in the "artsy" Wicker Park/Ukrainian Village neighborhood. Easy access to multiple means of public transportation downtown and beyond.

neighborhood_overview: my home is located on a gorgeous historic street in the Ukrainian village/wicker park neighborhood...this diverse and bustling neighborhood has so much to offer on it's own but is conveniently located just minutes from the downtown area.
notes: There is no AC in the room, AC is  portable and available upon request. I have two adorable,sweet and social kittens, Sam & Mila.
transit: the house is located approximately 6 short blocks to both the Damen & Division Blue Line stops.public transportation here is very efficient, fast and runs 24hrs. also, taxis are not very pricey if you chose that option.
access: my home is your home during your stay!!!
interaction: I live here but mostly keep to myself...a quiet and friendly introvert,for sure! sometimes i will bake and have bread/muffins/or sweet treats for guests.ALWAYS have coffee or tea on hand for you.happy to guide you to all that Chicago has to offer during your stay or to leave you be and discover on your own. Being a shared space, you will also have the potential to interact with other guests if you choose to do so!
house_rules: no shoes inside,so maybe bring some slippers, be nice and don't have parties or other people not booked here, please...outside on our stoop is a smoking area,if you smoke.really good people watching!!! Reservations for stays of 14+ days cannot use the instant book option!!! there is no curfew while staying here,no real "rules" except common courtesy (website hidden) especially nice & respectful to other guests- no brainer. i always want guests to feel as much at home s possible,so feel free to do so.if you need something just ask! most of all,enjoy your visit here!
host_about:
Creative Chicago native with an amazing space to share. been hosting via Airbnb for well over 8 yrs now and absolutely love it. an avid traveler myself, i very much enjoy meeting new people and helping guests get the most out of their time here as I have been in my own travels.
On a hiatus from interior design consulting,.. I am an artist and a quiet introvert. 
This space is a very special home with a serene and peaceful quality about it that happens to be in the center of the Wicker Park/Ukrainian village happenings. I love it here and thus far, most everyone who has stayed does as well!!

name: Darling Damen Dwelling (with bike if you like)
summary: Stay in the guest room of a vintage 2br, 1 bath apartment in the walkable heart of Chicago's North Center neighborhood: trees, yards, families, great restaurants and shops, safe day and night, and close to public transportation. More like a small town than the big city! All kind guests are welcome; you will find a cozy space in my quirky home. You will share the apartment (including bathroom) with me and my small dog Clarence (a poodle mix) and the multiple piles/projects I always have going on!
space: ATTENTION GUESTS: PLEASE READ ALL INFORMATION, MESSAGES, AIRBNB POLICIES, and HOUSE RULES; every Airbnb listing is different. You are responsible for knowing before you book. This vintage second-floor apartment in a three-flat house built in 1907 is a short walk to to two CTA Brown Line el stations, grocery stores, coffee shops, boutiques, breweries (Chicago's "Malt Row"), restaurants featuring many cuisines (Thai is a specialty here, among others - please see Guidebook for a few of my favorites), a large regional public library, public parks, and more. We have a summer farmer's market two blocks south, a Jewel supermarket just one block away, and Trader Joe's, Aldi, and another large grocery store are all 15-minute walks away. It is a shoes-off-at-the-door apartment. Slippers are provided if you like! The guest room is cozy and quiet with one queen-sized (very comfortable) bed. On it you will find fresh linens (changed weekly during longer stays). Extra blankets, a robe and slippers,
description: Stay in the guest room of a vintage 2br, 1 bath apartment in the walkable heart of Chicago's North Center neighborhood: trees, yards, families, great restaurants and shops, safe day and night, and close to public transportation. More like a small town than the big city! All kind guests are welcome; you will find a cozy space in my quirky home. You will share the apartment (including bathroom) with me and my small dog Clarence (a poodle mix) and the multiple piles/projects I always have going on! ATTENTION GUESTS: PLEASE READ ALL INFORMATION, MESSAGES, AIRBNB POLICIES, and HOUSE RULES; every Airbnb listing is different. You are responsible for knowing before you book. This vintage second-floor apartment in a three-flat house built in 1907 is a short walk to to two CTA Brown Line el stations, grocery stores, coffee shops, boutiques, breweries (Chicago's "Malt Row"), restaurants featuring many cuisines (Thai is a specialty here, among others - please see Guidebook for a few of my favorite
neighborhood_overview: I've lived in this neighborhood, a charming, tree-lined, residential one with very closeby commercial amenities, for more than 15 years, and I love hosting and "showing off" this fantastic city and my charming north side neighborhood called North Center - I think you'll enjoy yourself here! Feel free to ask any questions.
notes: PLEASE let me know your arrival and departure details (time and mode) at the time of your reservation. I can be able to be flexible on check-in times, but we MUST arrange specific times in advance. If there is a chance that you will be EARLY for your arrival time, PLEASE communicate this to me ASAP, and know that you may have to wait to check in. Late checkouts after 12 noon must be arranged prior to booking. Per Airbnb’s rules, you may be charged a late check-out fee. I expect guests to clean up after themselves, including dishes, be kind to me, my dog, and my neighbors, replace or pay for things they break or damage, be quiet late at night, and not to bring anyone into my home.  BICYCLE: If you'd like to use the guest bike (a vintage Schwinn suburban step-through), please let me know when you book! Chicago is a great place to get around by bike. The Schwinn is a comfortable upright cruiser with a step-through frame, and fenders that will fit riders from approximately 5'4" to 6'. Chic
transit: In addition to the train stations, we are steps from the #50 Damen Ave. bus (a direct route to both the Andersonville and the Wicker Park/Bucktown shopping/dining/nightlife areas) and short walks to two other east-west bus routes (#78 Montrose, #80 Irving Park). This is also a bike-friendly area, and you may request my loaner bicycle to use during your stay - please let me know *when you are booking.* The apartment is also a 15-to-20-minute walk to the Lawrence Ave. Metra commuter train station - this train goes to the northern suburbs and south to downtown.  If you drive, you may park your car on the street, permit-free, and spots are usually available right in front. I do not recommend driving into downtown from here.
access: The guest room includes light use of kitchen, bathroom, dining, living, lovely porch, and back yard with garden. Bedding and towels, robe and slippers, use of my electric kettle and french press or coffee maker are provided. Feel free to store your own food in the pantry, refrigerator and freezer, and cook light meals during your visit! Dishes and cookware is hand wash. Laundry is available in the basement, but please ask if you will need to use that.
interaction: Although I can be gone or busy working or studying from home during your stay, I live here with my sweet little dog  Clarence who is almost always home. Please keep him out of your room by keeping the gate in place, do not feed him, or let him out.  Please let me know if you have any feedback or concerns during your stay! I'm happy to communicate with you via this app (preferred), email, or phone during or prior to your visit.
house_rules: • You MUST be a dog-lover. Clarence is imperfect, attention-seeking, he barks, and he has free reign in the apartment (except your room). • Absolutely no smoking (of anything) in or near the apartment/porch/etc. • No guests! No sleepovers - only registered Airbnb guests in the apartment at all. • Please do not keep food in the guest room. • Please do not feed or let the dog out of his crates or the apartment. • Courtesy regarding noise and cleanliness in shared spaces is expected (do your dishes, use coasters, generally clean up the areas you use.) • Please leave bathroom door OPEN when you are not using it • PLEASE let me know when you book if you use any skin, hair, or intimate products that could damage my bed linens or towels.  Great communication is required for a great stay. Contact me right away with any specific questions or concerns - shared expectations is key. Thanks for looking, and enjoy your trip to Chicago!
host_about:
Welcome! I'm a nonprofit freelancer and TESOL graduate student living in (and loving) Chicago with my small but mighty dog Clarence. Live music, films, and art of all kinds are my favorite things, next to bicycles, dogs, and world peace.

I enjoy solo travel (and love to stay in interesting Airbnb homes!), cooking, organizing projects, gardening, and meeting new people, and I hope you fall for this great city and its neighborhoods during your visit with me. My place is always a work in progress - very homey, humble, and (I hope!) comfortable, and just a short train ride to downtown.

name: Historic Pullman Artist Flat
summary: Charming original 1880's Pullman workers flat in a wonderfully diverse community off the beaten path - Now a National Monument! Artists, historians, preservationists, architects, urban planners... Great place for creatives and explorers visiting Chicago! Your stay supports our visiting artist program.
space: Enjoy the entire 2nd Floor apartment of an original 1880's Pullman workers two flat row house. The building has been converted to Artist Live/Work Space (working art studio on the 1st floor /  apartment on 2nd floor - you will be renting the entire private 2nd floor apartment). Kitchen, relaxed backyard, washer dryer in the basement (if desired, by request).  The building has been featured on several Historic Pullman House Tours over the years. Unique space with lots of original charm.  20-30 minutes to downtown Chicago via metra train or quick access to the highway. Located in the heart of the Pullman Landmark District (Now a National Monument and part of the US National Park Service!).  Explore The Historic Pullman community via our Labor Tour guide (take a selfie while on tour and send it to us and we'll put it on our page! #mosnart). Walk to the Visitor Center and talk to a Park Ranger about the history of Pullman with interesting artifacts and more! Stroll through Arcade Park and
description: Charming original 1880's Pullman workers flat in a wonderfully diverse community off the beaten path - Now a National Monument! Artists, historians, preservationists, architects, urban planners... Great place for creatives and explorers visiting Chicago! Your stay supports our visiting artist program. Enjoy the entire 2nd Floor apartment of an original 1880's Pullman workers two flat row house. The building has been converted to Artist Live/Work Space (working art studio on the 1st floor /  apartment on 2nd floor - you will be renting the entire private 2nd floor apartment). Kitchen, relaxed backyard, washer dryer in the basement (if desired, by request).  The building has been featured on several Historic Pullman House Tours over the years. Unique space with lots of original charm.  20-30 minutes to downtown Chicago via metra train or quick access to the highway. Located in the heart of the Pullman Landmark District (Now a National Monument and part of the US National Park Service!).
neighborhood_overview: The entire town of Pullman was built in the 1880's as an industrialists utopian community to house his factory workers. It remains remarkably intact and is now part of the City of Chicago. Pullman has recently been designated a National Monument and is part of the US National Park Service (bring your NPS passport!) with friendly Park Rangers, self-guided and organized tours, a visitor center, and more. Explore labor history, model towns / planned communities, gilded age industrialism, all in a living/breathing community filled with preservationists, artists, creatives and the friendliest people you will find anywhere.  NOTES ON PULLMAN: The Pullman community is located on the far south side of Chicago and is in my opinion one of the most interesting and diverse areas of the city. People come from all over the world to see the historical remains (incredibly intact) of an industrialists utopia once touted "the worlds most perfect town" (now a National Monument). It is not the gold coast
transit: *More train info: The Metra Electric train runs from Pullman to the Chicago loop on a posted time schedule every few minutes during rush hours to once an hour during the rest of the day/evening Monday through Saturday and every two hours on Sunday. It is a 20 - 30 min ride to downtown. The last train of the evening leaves the Chicago loop 12:50 am. You can find a complete schedule on line at the metrarail site by looking up the Metra Electric Line (ME). The Kensington / 115th Street station is an easy 3 block walk from the flat and takes you to Millennium Park station in the heart of downtown Chicago. Most everyone loves the incredibly comfortable and quick train ride! If you are going to be taking it back and forth you can buy a 10 ride pass, Also offered are weekend passes with unlimited rides for only $8.00... Lots of Pullman people commute to downtown everyday!  Public Transportation from the airports:  O'Hare: Take the blue line el to the Washington stop and walk over to the metra
access: The entire flat is yours for your stay.
interaction: I give my guests space but am available if needed. Happy to get you settled in if desired.
house_rules: This is a fully furnished apartment, please make yourself at home.  Check-in check-out times are flexible unless there is someone else coming / going on the same date(s). In that case check-out is 11:00am or before and check-in is 3:00 pm or after. There is plenty of free street parking. The flat is not childproof and really isn't suitable for young kids.  also there is a no party policy.  No Smoking. Kitchen:  Help yourself to the calphalon commercial cookware hanging under the 12 foot wooden prep table and also feel free to use the abundance of salad spinners, food processors, blenders, slicers dicers, etc in the pantry. Please clean up after yourself. NOTE: The stove is old school and the oven must be manually lit for use (matches supplied). Towels / Linens: There are extra towels and bed linens in the hall closet if you need them. Please put the dirty ones in the hamper.  Backyard: Of course. Enjoy. Picnic table and chairs. Let me know in advance if you want to use the old weber ke
host_about:
Conceptual artist loves to explore... 

I've traded homes with artist friends from all over the USA and Europe and have shared spaces with dear friends and acquaintances long before airbnb was created (airbnb now expands those possibilities!). I think this is by far the most interesting and rewarding way to travel and experience some "there" there. I look forward to hosting and staying. 

I live in a 1880's  workers 2-flat converted to an apartment on the second floor and art studio on the first floor in the Historic Pullman neighborhood in Chicago, IL. I have a small organic food garden in the back and love to cook/prepare; raw, vegan/vegetarian, organic/healthy/gourmet - I'm not obliged to any specific diet so I enjoy lots of different foods and flavors. I try and learn one new thing a year - last year it was learning restoration of 1880's slate roof/facades with a craftsman and architect friends. This year, bringing artists to Pullman and Pullman to artists. Next, maybe exploring more permaculture ideas/trends.  

I have an absolutely lovely girlfriend who travels with me whenever possible (Amy). She is a social delight and has a wonderful way with people/cultures (like insisting on learning/speaking Spanish when we explored Spain). She offers a genuine ease with meeting new people and a welcoming charm. You'll like her.

Looking forward to meeting you...

-jb

name: Huge Bedroom with pvt marble bath
space: Italian style beautiful  apartment filled with art (paintings and sculptures) in Chicago Uptown. The room is part of a stunning 2 bedrooms 2 baths apartment, includes a very large master bedroom with huge walking closet and marble baths with double vanity and jacuzzi tub and a big guest bedroom with private marble bathroom with tub. Exceptionally big full kitchen with french doors to patio and large living room with fireplace. Washer and dryer in the unit.     Walking distance (3 blocks) to redline subway trains take you straight to downtown or the North portion of Chicago and Evanston.     The eclectic neighborhood has all you need within walking distance, including coffee shops (Starbucks), artisan bakeries, and food reflecting the area (African, Vietnamese, Pizza, Chinese, Japanese as well as upscale nouvelle cuisine, e.g., Magnolia Caffe). Shopping areas and a big Target and gym (World Gym) are minutes away.      The uptown entertainment district since Al Capone era, including

Italian-born professional based in Chicago who loves to travel around the World! 
I'm fluent in English, Italian, Spanish, German, and Portuguese. Feel free to contact me with inquires about my AirBnB rentals.

name: BROWN ROOM - WALK TO TRAIN TO O'HARE/DOWNTOWN
summary: This is one of two rooms listed for my home on AirBnB.  My home is midway between O'Hare Airport and Downtown Chicago in a safe and quiet neighborhood.  It's very convenient whether you drive or use public transportation (15 minutes to O'Hare, 20 to the Loop on Blue Line, CTA and Metra train stations are 3 blocks away).  Even though this is my home but Sergio and Cecilia who live on the second floor will be your host.  This will provide an immediate response.
space: My home is located on a tree-lined street in a quiet residential area of Irving Park.  Your room has a queen size bed with medium firm plush pillow top mattress, plenty of closet space, a large four-drawer chest, iron and ironing board, a desk, central heating/cooling.  The bathroom, across the hall, is a full bath with custom tiled shower complete with toiletries and towels; a hairdryer is also provided. My home is ideally situated near most everything: - 3 blocks from Blue Line train (Irving Park station) that's 5 mins. to Logan Square, 20 mins. to the Loop and 15 mins. to O'Hare - 3 blocks from Metra (suburbs) trains - 2 blocks from park with tennis courts and indoor swimming pool - 2 blocks from Walgreen's and supermarket - Within 4-8 blocks from X-Sports, Planet Fitness and YMCA - More than 30 restaurants within 10 blocks radius:  Thai, Chinese, Sushi, Mexican, Peruvian, Korean, South American, Middle Eastern, Moroccan, Mediterranean, Eastern European, Italian, German, Irish Pubs.

It's very convenient whether you drive or use public transportation (15 minutes to O'Hare, 20 to the Loop on Blue Line, CTA and Metra train stations are 3 blocks away). The bathroom, across the hall, is a full bath with custom tiled shower complete with toiletries and towels; a hairdryer is also provided. My home is ideally situated near most everything: - 3 blocks from Blue Line train (Irving Park station) that's 5 mins. to Logan
neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is one of Chicago's historic neighborhoods (my home is 100-years-old).  It's a safe and quiet neighborhood yet lively if you step out just a few blocks over onto Irving Park, Pulaski and Elston Avenue, where many restaurants and pubs are situated.  I feel safe walking to and from the Blue Line station as late as midnight, but being aware of your surroundings is always a good policy. I list many nearby favorite restaurants and their locations in my guidebook.
notes: The second floor tenants has 2 dogs.  They are well behaved, but they will not enter this apartment. This is a one hundred-year-old renovated building.  There may be creaky sounds from the floor above but usually in the daytime. Room rates are seasonal from$45-$60 per night plus a second guest and cleaning fees.  Longer occupancy considered on a case by case basis.
transit: If you plan to use the Chicago Transit Authority system often, you can buy CTA passes at a currency exchange, major food and drug stores (1-day $10, 3-day $20, 7-day $28). A single fare is $3 for both buses and trains within two hours. Prices are subject to change.
access: My guests are welcome to: - WI-FI access throughout the house - Watch TV with your Roku account in the living room - Gourmet coffee and tea anytime - Sharing my kitchen and fridge - Relaxing in the garden's patio seating - Free maps and CTA schedules - Chicago guidebooks and activity brochures - Free daily permit parking front of home (let me know if you drive) - Free use of washer/dryer and iron/ironing board
interaction: I let my guests decide how much they want my interaction.   But, I appreciate guests' understanding of my private time and space.
house_rules: - Please apprise me of any problem or cause of your discomfort immediately, so I can remedy them while you are here. - Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen. - No perishable food in the bedroom - No outdoor shoes in the house - No pets - We conserve energy and resources, compost (plant based scrap), recycle (clean aluminum, plastic bottles and paper products). - No smoking inside the house. - You are free to come and go anytime, but please be considerate at late hours.
host_about: I'm originally from Thailand and have been living in Chicago area for over 30 years, and know the city inside out.  I love Chicago for its diverse ethnicity, theaters, museums, entertainment venues and restaurants.  I love scuba diving and go back to Thailand every year.  I used to work for Accenture but retired now.  My other hobbies are golf and pickleball.

name: Luxe Modern Condo in Lakeview
summary: Hi friends! I can't wait to meet you and welcome you to your wonderful home-away-from-home in beautiful Chicago! As detailed in the title, this property is higher-end, so you'll feel well cared for when you arrive! It's also been heavily discounted for the off season, so don't miss your chance to stay here!  I'm happy to recommend all the best things to see, do and eat in the city as well, so please ask! Chicago is one of the best places on earth, and I look forward to sharing it with you! :)
space: A favorite reclusive getaway for many A list actors, celebrities, artists, professional musicians, major league baseball players, entrepreneurs, European business leaders and other professional sports athletes, this bright and contemporary 1 bedroom (there are, in fact, 2 bedrooms in the unit but only 1 is available for use; the other is storing some personal belongings), immaculately-maintained, fully-furnished garden condo in N Lakeview will make you feel right at home when you arrive.  It features high-end furnishings and thoughtful details throughout including a gourmet kitchen, top-of-the-line linens, super fast WIFI, and à la carte TV programming on demand.  This fully furnished property additionally comes equipped with indoor grilling on a professional Wolf range, Bosch DW, disposal, two refrigerators (stand alone + island drawer fridge), coin-op laundry down the hall ($2.00 to wash and drying is free), a community BBQ on the deck out back, and secure bike parking alongside the

As detailed in the title, this property is higher-end, so you'll feel well cared for when you arrive! It's also been heavily discounted for the off season, so don't miss your chance to stay here!  I'm happy to recommend all the best things to see, do and eat in the city as well, so please ask! Chicago is one of the best places on earth, and I look forward to sharing it with you! :) A favorite reclusive getaway for many A list actors, celebrities, artists, professional musicians, major league baseball players, entrepreneurs, European business leaders and other professional sports athletes, this bright and contemporary 1 bedroom (there are, in fact, 2 bedrooms in the unit but only 1 is available for use; the other is storing some personal belongings), immaculately-maintained, fully-furnished garden condo in N Lakeview will make you feel right at home when you arrive.  It featu
neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is is bursting with young urban professionals and young families. It is the most tree-lined neighborhood in the city, and the home of Wrigley Field. And since it sits exactly adjacent to the lake, so you'll always have easy lake front path access. It's also just 15-20 min north of the heart of downtown on the train, or about 5-8 min driving on Lakeshore Drive.
transit: As detailed in the opening, a dedicated, gated and secure parking space in a lot just across the street is INCLUDED with your booking. Additionally, the property sits on two major bus lines and within 3 minutes walking distance to a Red Line train station which will take you directly into downtown (a 20 min ride, give or take your destination). Taxis, of course, are also always everywhere. So you will be very well connected to anywhere you need to go.
access: A few days before you check in I'll send you a custom code to access the callbox outside the building and instructions for how to enter the space. The entire property is yours to enjoy from there!
interaction: I live and work out of country but I'm available anytime 24 hours a day should you need anything. And I'll always respond quickly (generally within 2- 15 minutes) when you do!
house_rules: Make yourself at home! Cook, watch movies, relax...  Just please no smoking, pets or partying like it's 1999 - THANK YOU!!
host_about:
Hey everyone! 

Thanks for checking out my properties, I hope you'll come to stay! 

A little about me: I'm a 39 year old professional photographer, traveler and serial entrepreneur. I've Sailed from Panama to Fiji over 7 months and solo cycled New Zealand and Australia for 6. I spent 4 weeks on a spiritual hermitage in India, trekked around Europe a bit, bushwhacked around the jungles of Panama treasure hunting 16th century Spanish artifacts, and have fallen in love with Cuba, twice. 

I recently lived in Costa Rica for 18 months but now live in Guanajuato, Mexico, developing several businesses. 

My life motto is, 'What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?' And I'd eat guacamole or hummus every day if at all humanly possible! :)

I lived in Chicago for 9 years, and I've lived in Guanajuato now for the past 3 years, so I'm happy to recommend all the best bars, restaurants and activities (and tourist traps to avoid). I love giving local advice so please feel free to ask! 

And if ever you need anything, I'm always just a quick call, text or email away!

I hope you enjoy your visit to Chi or GTO, and I look forward to sharing my homes with you!

Cheers,
Dana

name: Quiet Bedroom/ARAGON/Train
summary: This is a small cozy bedroom on the 2nd floor. No food or drinks are provided ever. This is not a bed and breakfast.
space: We are RIGHT NEXT TO THE TRAIN! We are designated as Super Hosts by airbnb and have had over 1000, guests. We guarantee enclosed, safe parking on the premises for one car if there is no parking on the street. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is incredibly diverse and is known as the most diverse in Chicago with all races, income levels, lifestyles and nationalities. You may see a stretch limo with President Barak Obama coming out to celebrate his birthday in  2013 at the Aragon across the street from our home, or a flesh eating zombie, coming out of a limo to celebrate their 40th birthday at the Uptown Underground.
transit: The train that takes you everywhere in the city is 1/2 block away and runs 24/7 every 5 minutes.
access: The living room and outside deck on first floor. Please make sure the Front Gate is locked at all times. Simply reach through the grate to open or close the lock from the outside.
interaction: As much or as little as the guest requires.
house_rules: PLEASE DO - be respectful of personal belongings, - make yourself at home - go out and enjoy the neighborhood - call or text us if you have any questions -We do not allow guests from the outside to come into the house without prior consultation. ALWAYS MAKE SURE THE FRONT GATE IS CLOSED AND LOCKED. Do not clean stainless steel appliances a special cleaner is needed, otherwise scratches will appear.  Common sense required.
host_about: We are easy going, relaxed, have a sense of humor and are helpful in many ways to all our guests.

name: Close to Michigan Ave and parks
summary: One bedroom,1 bathroom..
space: McCormick Place. The Lake Shore path for biking, running, or walking is accessible just two blocks south or four blocks north.  The trail runs from Hyde Park to Sheridan - over twenty miles of playground right outside your door. This penthouse has 14 foot ceilings.  The bedroom has a queen bed  with a walk-in closet.  You are also able to sleep 2 more on a queen double high air mattress in the den/office.  Washer and dryer in condo.  1 parking spot in the garage is included. Easy access to public transportation — Lots of great restaurants are within walking distance — Italian, sushi, Mexican, Pizza, Hungarian, deli — it's all right here in the burgeoning South Loop.

neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance of McCormick Convention Center, Museums, CTA Trains and Busses, Major Grocery Chain and many excellent restaurants.
notes: There are the City Bike rentals two blocks away for easy access to most of the city, Navy Pier and Magnificent Mile Shopping as well as the Rush Street restaurants just a bit farther north.
transit: Major CTA Train station 5 blocks away and major bus route 1/2 block away.
house_rules: My rules are simple, we want visitors to relax, make themselves at home and respect this space that we love so much! Oh and.... ***$500 fee for LOST KEYS. ***Absolutely NO ANIMALS ***Absolutely NO SMOKING in apartment or building.  ***Please don't hang out in the hallways. ***No PARTIES and NO LOUD MUSIC. Neighbors will complain. ***Please turn off all ELECTRICITY and AIR or HEAT when leaving ***Leave the KEYS on counter, the door will lock behind you. Most of all have a SAFE TRIP HOME, thank you for staying and leaving the condo is amazing shape. PLEASE when asked to review your stay, DO NOT ANSWER ANY PUBLIC VIEWS FOR OTHERS TO SEE!!!.  We have plenty, just answer the PERSONAL and AIRBNB so we know how much you loved your stay and hospitality.  We will give you a great review and hope to see you again soon.
host_about:
A little about me...

People tell me I am easy going, social and love people.  My passion is outdoor activities.  I'm married (to a beautiful wife and I have 4 "almost" grown-up kids.

We enjoy family, traveling, downhill skiing, outdoor recreation, and the exciting city of Chicago.

name: Studio Apartment Unit 4
summary: Your own private entrance and apartment on the ground floor of an elegant three-storey building in a quiet residential neighborhood.  Only a short walk to bus and train to downtown, one mile from beaches and restaurants.  Free street parking.
space: This is a beautifully detailed apartment in quiet three flat building -- furnished simply with mid-century modern-- queen sized bed, full kitchen, marble bath.Network television, free wi-fi internet and parking are available.  If you're visiting Chicago or Evanston this is centrally located between Northwestern University and Loyola.  Public transportation to downtown Evanston and Chicago loop nearby.  This is a newly constructed studio apartment in an elegant 1928 building on a quiet street away from traffic.  It is owner occupied and well cared for.  Back yard and laundry facilities are available.  You'll want to stay longer and explore the nearby parks and golf course.  A YMCA pool and gym is nearby.  Visiting Chicago or your family has never been easier, or  more private.  Suitable for one or two adults. A two level space includes a "stage" and dining area. notes: 32 night minimum stay
transit: The 96 bus is one block away, which connects to the Elevated train "L" to downtown, or to the 147 bus that goes down Lake Shore Drive to Michigan Avenue or downtown.  There is also a Metra stop a five minute walk away that goes to the west Loop.

name: You'll love Chicago! Guaranteed!
space: Chicago at your fingertips! -  Nightlife, Restaurants, Shopping, Theater, Comedy Clubs, Lakefront Lakefront - Head east on Division from the this apartment and you will have to choose between North Avenue beach or Oak Street beach.  Bike rental, volleyball courts and restaurants at both beaches.  The lakefront path is beautifully maintained and connects the North and South side of the city.  You can get to any of Chicago's greatest attractions from Lincoln Park Zoo, to Navy Pier, to Millennium park, to the Shedd Aquarium to name a few.  Nightlife - No transit required... You are in the heart of classic Chicago nightlife.  Division street is full of bars as are State and Rush.   Restaurants - head north on Wells and you will find some great options for dining.  Or head eat to State and Rush and choose from Carmines, Lux Bar, Gibson's Steak House, Hugo's Frog Bar,  Lou Malnatis, to name a few good eats.  Shopping - walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and a short cab ride to Bucktown

house_rules: NO SMOKING in unit or courtyard   Be respectful of neighbors.   No shoes in apartment.   Please take out trash regularly and at the end of your stay.  The dump is down the garage stairs and through the door (key for re-entry needed).   Do not leave the apartment/building without the keys...you will lock yourself out indefinitely.  Please leave all dirty linens on the bedroom floor at the end of your stay.
host_about: I live in Chicago with my husband and three children ages 5 and 3 and 1.  I am a stay at home mom.  I left teaching middle school Spanish to raise my children.  My husband is the owner of Chicago Bone Broth, a Movnat trainer and wellness coach.  We love good food, adventure, traveling and meeting new people... airbnb has helped us to continue to do this and share in all of it with our children.  As hosts we enjoy meeting travelers from around the world and giving them a clean and equipped place they can call home while they are exploring the area.

name: Steps From the Best Chicago Offers
summary: Hotel type amenities (in excess) upon arrival...please reference the text in 'The Space' section for a detailed description.  You won't find a better deal for a premium condo such as this, in which case hotels would charge in excess of $500/night!
space: Hotel type amenities (in excess) upon arrival... This 2 Bedroom, 1.5 bathroom condo is ideal for the temporary or even elongated stay traveler.  Located just across the Chicago River from the Merchandise Mart, its ideally located for several means of transportation and short walks to all the best spots in the city to eat, grab drinks, or see a venue.  The unit is completely furnished with premium furnishings throughout, and washer/dryer in unit.  For the pleasure traveler, it is complete with DirecTV satellite, Apple TV, and 50" plasma for movie enjoyment or catching a game on television.  For the business traveler, complete with a 36" LCD TV in the kitchen for A/V connection for presentations, all in one HP wireless printer, and plenty of desk space on kitchen granite counter tops, dining room, or desk in the master bedroom for work. I also have a grill on the balcony, for your use if you wish to entertain during your stay. I have priced this unit nightly based on full autonomous use.

neighborhood_overview: It is Chicago's hottest area, centrally located from all the best venues in the city as well.  The neighborhood is thriving, is extremely safe, and simply a joy to live in and traverse.
notes: Plenty of great dining options to choose from within walking distance.  If you are interested in high-end Michelin rated prix fixe dining, please let me know early as some of them have a two month wait list but often times I can accommodate getting you in as well.
transit: The nearest 'L' stop is at Clinton/Lake.  The nearest bus stop is a block away.  Otherwise, taxi's are plentiful in this neighborhood and relatively easy to come by.  That said, I personally always prefer walking everywhere in the area, as the neighborhood is enjoyable.
access: Guests are given full access of the condo.
interaction: Due to extenuating circumstances, I've only missed one opportunity to meet a guest upon their arrival, but always have contingencies set up to ensure seamless check-in and hand-over of the condo for each stay.  Once we link up, I am within a call or email away from any additional questions.

host_about:
Welcome to Chicago.  This area is known as Fulton River District, and is truly in the middle of it all, distanced enough to be quiet as well.  I am certain you will enjoy your stay.  Reach out with any questions.

Best,
Michael

name: Logan Square Classic Bungalow
summary: Get to know Chicago by jumping off from a Classic Logan Square Bungalow.  My 100+ year old home is a great place to explore the city from the coolest neighborhood in town.  And I will give you tips to see/ do/ eat the best Chicago has to offer.
space: The house was built in 1908 and has all of the charm of an old home, but with all of the modern conveniences of today (wireless internet, AC, television, etc).  The guest room is comfortable with a double bed, dresser, mirror, ceiling fan, a window air conditioning unit (summer months only), two chairs, cd player, record player (on request) and a storage rack for hanging clothes.  I provide current issues of the Chicago Reader for the curious traveler.  There is a washer/ dryer in the basement and a kitchen is available.  The kitchen was completely remodeled in September 2011 and was voted as a finalist in the 2012 Richard H. Driehaus Foundation Awards presented by the Historic Chicago Bungalow Association.  The first floor bath was also remodeled in January of 2012 and a brand new second floor bathroom was added in the spring of 2014 for exclusive guest use.

The first floor bath was also remodel
neighborhood_overview: My place is located in the greatest part of Logan Square.  Logan Square is a dynamic neighborhood where tons of great things happen.  Short walks to the Centennial Monument, Lula Cafe, The Logan Square Farmers Markets (summer and winter), Longman and Eagle, The Owl, Palmer Square, Wolfbait and B Girls, Estereo, Hopewell Brewing, The Logan Square Auditorium, Daisey, The Congress Theater, Revolution Brewing, Boulevard Bike Shop, The Rocking Horse, The Whistler, shopping, art, parks and everything else Logan Square has to offer.
transit: The house is located near many modes of transportation.  It’s just a seven minute walk to the Logan Square train stop on the Blue Line or a ten minute walk to the California Blue Line stop.  The #74 Fullerton bus stop is a three minute walk and the #56 Milwaukee bus stop is two minutes away.  Zipcar and IGo pickup locations are very close as is the Kennedy expressway.   There is also easy, safe, permit parking on the street.  You can usually find a spot directly in front and I will provide free, daily parking passes if requested.
access: You will have full access to most of the house.  Including sun room, back yard, kitchen and washer and dryer.  Breakfast will not be offered in house, but I do provide gift cards to New Wave Coffee or Reno.  Two great places to pick up coffee or a quick breakfast.  Both are short walks from my place.
interaction: I love to interact with my guests.  I have been a resident of Chicago since 1995 and a proud resident of the Logan Square neighborhood since 2000.  I am an avid traveler and I love to provide insightful information and tips to fellow (Website hidden by Airbnb) will also be able to reach me via phone/ text.
house_rules: ~ Please respect my home and my possessions. ~You will receive a key at check in. ~ No smoking is allowed inside the house.  ~ No weapons of any kind are allowed. ~ Guests must be at least 21 years of age. ~ Maximum two guests- no visitors. ~ No drug use or possession. ~ Quiet hours are from 11pm to 9am.  It's fine if you leave or arrive before or after these hours, just do so quietly. ~ Enjoy Logan Square and your stay in Chicago.  It is a great place!
host_about: I am a proud resident of the Logan Square community (since 2000) and the city of Chicago (since 1995).  As an avid traveler I love getting insider tips from locals.  As a host on Air BnB, I love giving great tips to guests.  Other interests include- travel, food, live music, urban hiking, Cubs baseball, drinking good coffee, welding, craft wine/ beer, reading, biking.

Even though, it is the south side of Chicago this is a nice, clean, quiet working class community, with neighborhood watch!!!  If you are a very light sleeper there is a freight train that comes occasionally behind my house only light sleepers are bothered by it.
notes: I don't entertain male guest!  I have a houser manager that is also available to  assist you in any way, his name is Alden and he is also an Uber driver!

host_about: I am an outgoing person who loves to travel and have fun.  When I am home, I am quiet and cool, usually reading, grading papers or watching TV. I love sharing my home with visitors because I enjoy meeting new people!  The other person in the picture is Alden my house manager!  If I’m not around, he’ll be there to take excellent care of you.

name: Downtown 3BR/2BA Loft & Amazing River View
summary: The condo is arguably the most central location in Chicago for easy commuting and walking to most of the things out-of-towners want to see.  Long-term stays of six-months or longer only.
space: A large Three-Bedroom Loft Apartment with stunning Chicago River Views in the heart of Chicago.  Ideally located within five minutes walk of rapid transit to O'Hare and Midway airports as well as to the two main train stations--Union Station and Olgilvy Center.  Theatre district, Civic Opera, River North, Loop, and West Loop all walking distance.  Parking Space available as well.

To the East just across the river is the Loop which is the formal business center of Chicago.  To the north is River North and all of the shopping and boutiques.  We're right in the middle of all the action.
notes: This apartment is available for long-term rental only---minimum of 12 months.
transit: Yes.  All the major transit lines and transport options (Trains, Subway, buses, and public bicycles) are located within two blocks of the condo.  The two main train stations are within those two blocks.  Easy to get to and from O'Hare or Midway airports via subway (only $1.75 !!! ).
access: This will be your full apartment for one-year.
interaction: I often interact with Guests (though I don't live in the condo) as does one of the long-term renters who has received lots of good reviews for his helpfulness  and being a good host.
house_rules: The minimum stay is 1 year.
host_about: Co-Founder of Chicago-based Medical Devices company.  Former Head of Marketing and E-Business at Audi as well as former Global Head of Internet Marketing at Motorola.  I am guy who likes to travel and stay in the centers of great cities but not stay at hotels that lack local character and charm.  Married with three kids. Cal Grad--'90.

name: Sunny Home w/ Private Bathroom, Parking, Laundry
summary: Come stay in one of Chicago's rare, historic carriage houses! Located on a quiet street in hip Bucktown, you are steps to restaurants, shopping, bars, and an 8-minute walk to the Blue Line train. This is a very walkable area, day or night!
space: Hi there.  This historic coach house is conveniently located close to everything Bucktown has to offer, plus close to the Blue Line train and the highway. Parking is included! This private bedroom room is perfect for long-term stays as it is very private - no shared walls, separated from the other bedroom by the full laundry room. There's a queen bed, dresser, nightstand, full closet, and a retro egg chair in the room. There's a little patio for you to use, too! About the neighborhood: Located in the heart of Bucktown this gem is just steps away from rad bars, cafes, and boutique shops, such as Ipsento, The Charleston, Le Bouchen, The Bristol, Hot Chocolate, the Map Room. We centrally located in Bucktown which is 5 minutes from both Logan Square and Wicker Park. The room comes with a parking spot and also street parking is free and easy to find, with transit just 2 blocks away for the bus or 5 blocks for the Blue Line. neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is so great! We are steps away from Bucktown boutiques, high-end restaurants, cafes, bars, and the 8-minute walk to the train makes the city so accessible.
notes: Please do not use the fireplace, but if you would like a fire when I'm home let me know and I'm happy to get it going for you.
transit: 8 minute walk to the Blue Line Western Stop, connecting you to O'Hare and downtown. 15 minute train ride to downtown, 25 minutes to the airport. We are just of the highway, too, and if you're driving let me know as I have a parking space you can use!
access: Feel free to do laundry - I have a laundry room in the unit. I just ask that long-term guests (7 or more days) supply their own detergents and such. You are welcome to use the patio, too!
interaction: I'm happy to help you get started on your way with dining or transit suggestions. Please feel free to text me with any questions. I'm not home all too often but am very accessible by phone. Don't be shy, I want you to fall in love with Chicago!
house_rules: Hey there. I'm super laid back and hope the same of you. Just clean up after yourself and be respectful. Should you need something please ask. Thanks for considering!
host_about:
Hi, I'm hailey. I love snacks and bicycles and honey bees. 
More than anything I am laid-back and easy-going, and would love it if you made yourself at home.
Cheers!

neighborhood_overview: Our area is quiet, and  safe.  We have great local restaurants that feature the best pizza and all of our original Chicago sandwiches.  You can save a lot of money eating locally or there are hundreds of 5 star restaurants to choose from that are minutes away..  There are also great 4 star restaurants in our area such as Nana Organic, Han 202, and others.
notes: Our guests must be responsible adults 23 and older who are not on a wild party trip.  Our rentals are a very bad fit for very hard partiers.  Have fun !!!, but we can't have the party come back to the apartment.
transit: It's 1/2 block to the bus and 1/2 mile to the red line train.  That train runs north and south throughout the entire city and is very close to all of our major attractions.
access: You will have your own fully private apartment with private entrances.  Our building has 2 apartments.   The hot tub, roof deck, and backyard patio for outdoor cooking and dining area are shared.   The 2nd bathroom is a 1/2 bathroom with sink and toilet.  It is located in our basement and can be used by both apartments.
interaction: We love to meet our guests and have had guests from all over the world in 10 years of offering rentals at this location.  We are available whenever you need help or advice.
house_rules: We have a few policies that we need you to review before reserving your rental.   We don't host parties of any kind.   Our rentals are really not a good fit for the very late night 2-5 am or very hard partying crowd.  Noise late at night or excessive noise anytime is very disturbing.    We ask guests to show consideration for other guest and our neighbors who may be sleeping after 11 pm and keep noise down to normal levels.  Sorry, but we do not rent to anyone coming for music festivals or concerts.   A few groups in the past have ruined that for everyone.  We are in a quiet residential area and our guests and our neighbors appreciate and enjoy a quiet environment.   Minimum Age Limit for Renters : We don't rent to adults under 23 years of age or for parties or gatherings of any kind.   We will consider adults 23 or older with additional screening. The maximum capacity of the apartment is 6 people in 3 queen beds (and an air bed that can be set up for one extra sleeping space). We will
host_about:
We are two friends who bought this building and lived in it for 8 years.    We completely renovated everything for our own comfort.   You will find many great amenities that you won't normally find in the average rental.

We are lifelong Chicago residents and we are glad to help you enjoy your stay in our city.   We have an extensive guest guide that we will send you that will give you our best ideas for dining, shopping, and transportation around our city.     If you need some advice or have a question, we are here to help.

name: WHOLE PRIVATE FLOOR near Train
space: Very comfortable, private lower level of duplex. Perfect for a business traveler who doesn't want to be downtown, or a couple visiting the city for pleasure. Private entrance; separate bedroom (queensize bed), bathroom (w/tub), large living area with 42" flat screen TV and lots of seating area. ALL linens changed between guests, including mattress pads and comforters. Although this space does NOT have a kitchen,  there is a microwave, mini refrigerator, electric kettle for water and coffee maker.  Coffee, tea, bottled water, light breakfast items, and snacks included.  Lovely condo building with great neighbors; one block to Brown Line (Kedzie stop) with easy transfer to the Red Line. Thai, Persian, Lebanese, Mexican, Chinese,  Chicago style hot dogs, American breakfast all in walking distance plus Starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, liquor store and our favorite neighborhood grocery store. Also nearby is Arun's renowned Thai restaurant. Street parking. Free Wi-Fi, cable (extensive channels)

interaction: I try to meet each guest, and am available by phone, text and e-mail.

host_about: Love: my 22  year old son; cooking; movies;  outdoor space; Pontooning and sailing with my boat-owning friends, Chicago Bears,  travel; and my good, good friends! I'm excited to be part of Airbnb!

name: Spacious, Vintage Hyde Park Apt.
space: Our apartment is a third floor walk up in a lovely 1910 condo. The room is spacious, light, and quiet with an en suite bathroom. A ceiling fan and window AC are available for warm weather. The neighborhood is tree-lined and beautiful.  It is a short walk to public transportation that will take you downtown in 15 minutes (the Metra train, and the#6 and #2 Express buses to the Loop). And we are a 5 minute walk from the lakefront bike and running path and several beaches.  There are city rental bikes available on the way to the bike path. Hyde Park is the home of  the University of Chicago,the Museum of Science and Industry, the Court Theater, the Smart Gallery, the Renaissance Gallery, and the Hyde Park Art Center, as well as President Obama’s residence. We are located about a mile from the University campus. Plenty of street parking is available near the apartment.. There are a variety of restaurants and cafes in walking distance. As your hosts we will make sure that you get any informa
description: Our apartment is a third floor walk up in a lovely 1910 condo. The room is spacious, light, and quiet with an en suite bathroom. A ceiling fan and window AC are available for warm weather. The neighborhood is tree-lined and beautiful.  It is a short walk to public transportation that will take you downtown in 15 minutes (the Metra train, and the#6 and #2 Express buses to the Loop). As your hosts we will make sure that you get any informa
notes: Dogs:  Ella, the older lab, will always bark when you enter (and sometimes growl) but her tail is wagging and she is a sweetheart.  Just talk to her.  Finn is a big happy puppy and will greet you enthusiastically.  We would appreciate it, if you don't let him jump (turn your back on him). He is very social and being trained. Water:  You can drink the tap water and we keep filtered water in the frig. Help yourself. Guests:  No outside guests please without prior permission. Keys:  We will give you key instructions as this is an old building with old locks.
access: Guests may use the refrigerator for limited groceries and the microwave and toaster.  No cooking on the stove is permitted as we do a lot of cooking, especially in the evenings.  And we prefer that guests don't eat in the bedroom as there is plenty of eating space in the kitchen/dining area.
house_rules: No pets. No smoking in the apartment.  No eating in the room.  Large kitchen and dining room and balcony available for eating. Microwave, refrigerator, tea kettle, washer and dryer available for use.
host_about: I am a photographer and my husband is a writer.  We have lived in Hyde Park for 35 years and raised two children here.  We run, bike, and swim with our two labs, Ella and Finn, and love to hike.  We have lived in this apartment for 17 years and did extensive rehab. We garden in a community garden in the neighborhood and do a lot of cooking.

space: Rent a spacious historic  home in the University of Chicago neighborhood, just a ten minute walk from Lake Michigan and 10 minute drive to downtown.  With a full kitchen, dining, living room and four bedrooms you will have plenty of space for a Chicago adventure!  Ideal for families or scholars visiting the University of Chicago or a conference at McCormick Place.  You are in the thriving, intellectual neighborhood of more than 72 Nobel Laureates, one block from theater, coffee shops, Whole Foods and restaurants on 53rd including French/Italian A10, The Promontory, Chant, Starbucks, Porkchop, Pizza Capri, 5 Guys, Nando's Peri Peri and the classic kitchen of Valois.  The bus stop and Metra Electric line is a five minute walk from whisking you away to world-class restaurants, The Art Institute of Chicago, the Aquarium, the shops on Magnificent mile, and free concerts in award-winning Millennium Park! name: Luxury Chicago Loft, 1 blk to train w/ 2 pkg spots
summary: Luxury Wrigleyville loft in one of the best areas of Chicago.  ONE block from public transportation that can take you to the downtown area.  Very safe neighborhood that has families and fun. Experience Chicago like a local.
space: ****Wrigleyville Loft 3 blocks way from Wrigley field****    ------------------------------- If you are thinking about staying in a Chicago Hotel....DON'T!!  "ala" David Letterman....Here are the TOP REASONS why you should stay at our Chicago Loft 1. FREE PARKING:  Most Chicago hotels are now charging $65 PER NIGHT to park a car. neighborhood_overview: Located in Wrigleyville, a small area of the Lake View neighborhood, the loft is just four blocks from historic Wrigley Field and one block from the Brown-line/Red-line "L" stop. Restaurants and theaters are within a seven-block radius.
transit: The Chicago Transit Authority ( CTA ) Belmont stop is 1 block from the Loft Taxi’s can easily be hailed in front of the loft at all hours of the day
access: Full Access to the entire Loft / Apartment, including 2 private outdoor parking spots
interaction: Send a text and i will promptly respond
house_rules: **No smoking inside (on the balcony is fine).  **Please be clean and considerate.   **No loud music  after 10 PM  ** No Pets ** No Parties ** Maximum guest = 4 Please treat the Loft as it was yours. Make sure that when you Check Out it is the same condition as when you Checked In.  Please don't break or steal anything!  Several books had already been taken without permission or payment.   Not cool! Security deposit of $250 is  required Lost keys- $150 per set, to be paid in cash to the owner before departure Smoking in the house: $200 fee will be assessed if we return and smell tobacco smoke in the house. Forgotten items-  $30 flat fee, per item such as chargers, small personal items, etc.  The fee is to be paid via ( (Hidden by Airbnb) ) if you would like your items shipped to you within the continental US.   If you reside outside the US, the fee will be negotiated.
host_about: After living in this beautiful city for 18 years, I have discovered some unique places- I think you will find it as amazing as I do, regardless of the season. My home is a GEM in the heart of the city! If you are new to Chicago, I can leave a list of all of my favorite places as suggestions for you to visit, dine and see, both on and off the beaten path.

summary: **PLEASE READ FULL DESCRIPTION BELOW AND CLICK "CONTACT HOST" BEFORE REQUESTING A BOOKING** Downtown urban designer home near subway/Loop/United Center. Perfect for business or casual groups, can sleep 12+. Spacious with huge deck in trendy, central River West! Walk to restaurants, cafes, nightlife. 2 subway stops to Loop, 40 minutes direct to airports.
space: Enjoy a stay at a world travelers' Windy City home! **PLEASE READ OUR DESCRIPTION AND CLICK "CONTACT HOST" BEFORE REQUESTING TO BOOK! WE SOMETIMES HAVE GROUPS PENDING WHICH WON'T APPEAR IN OUR CALENDAR UNTIL CONFIRMED.** **SPECIAL NOTES -- PLEASE READ FIRST** -- We typically require 3-night weekends; and defer to longer stay groups (4-5+ nights) beyond 30 days in advance. We release remaining weekend inventory within the 30-day window, or when other bookings align. Please feel free to inquire accordingly, as we often get overlapping requests.  -- Some special event dates may require longer stays, such as: Lollapalooza, Chicago Marathon, holidays, etc. Please inquire first, thanks! Modern, renovated, luxury Chicago condo is available for short or long term stays.  Our ideal downtown location is just two subway stops (~10 minutes) from the loop, Michigan Ave. shopping, museums & Lake Michigan.  We are centrally located in the River West neighborhood, with close proximity to United Center

neighborhood_overview: River West is one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Chicago, with terrific access to mass transit, downtown, and surrounding nightlife!
transit: Very easy access to Blue Line subway and/or bus lines. Straight shot to ORD airport. Plenty of taxi and/or Uber options in the neighborhood. Free off-street parking.
access: Entire apartment is available.  (Two units in the building may also be combined, when available, to sleep up to 26+.)
house_rules: We ask that you enjoy our home as your own, in a courteous manner for future guests.   - Please use towels, toiletries, air conditioning, water, etc. responsibly. - No smoking - No pets - PLEASE -- No shoes or rolling luggage upstairs, to maintain the quality of our carpet. - Please do not move furniture around in the apartment.  In particular, do not drag furniture across the hardwood floors. - Please do not use the concrete kitchen counter as a cutting board, as it can scratch the surface.  Wood & plastic cutting boards are provided for cooking. - Finally, no loud music after 10:00 p.m. to respect our neighbors.   All bookings will require owner's confirmation prior to arrival.
host_about: We are global travel junkies and love to talk about destinations with our guests.  We've been to over 65 countries, and maintain a wanderlust for exploring new destinations and encountering new friends. We look forward to welcoming you!

name: Trains to downtown. McCormick. IIT.
summary: Close to downtown Chicago, IIT, McCorMick Place Convention Center. Private bedroom (approx. 120 SF). Full bed.  Shared bath. It's a garden/basement apartment, 4' below ground, 4' above ground. Industrial Bohemian decor with exposed concrete floor.
space: Complete with full bed, desk, closet, sofa, linen organize, TV. YES, you have two good-size windows in your bedroom, for fresh-air and sunshine :) FREE in-unit washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI, 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 2 stops to reach downtown).. Also many buses to downtown but buses will take a little longer. Cool central air conditioning at nights in the Summer. Warmy central heat in the winter.  A modern-day cave in a 3 bedroom 1 bath "basement" apartment of a gut-renovated Victorian Rowhouse. The overall apartment is approximately 1,000 SqFt. You will have a private bedroom. Shared bath with 2 other roommates, a grad student and/or a intern student and/or a professional.  Small modern kitchen with small dining area. No living room.  * 3 blocks walk to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier. * Only 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should
