name: Eclectic 2BR w/ Vintage Charm
summary: This sunny West Town 2BR is a perfect place to call home after a day of exploring Chicago. Located on the top floor of a 3rd floor walk-up on a quiet residential street, just a few blocks away from bars, shops and restaurants.
space: This apt is on the 3rd floor in the rear of building away from the street, so incredibly quiet and peaceful with tons of natural sunlight. High ceilings, large windows, vintage furnishings, open floor plan with two bedrooms, one off the kitchen with a twin bed and 2nd bedroom off of the living room with a queen bed. The apt can fit up to 3 people with 2 on the queen and 1 on the twin. There is an air mattress that fits in either twin room or living room should you need it.  ***NOTE: This is a prewar building, circa 1910 construction. Recent renovations have taken place, but the building and apt DO maintain their "vintage charm". Please advise if you are used to hotel stays or modern apartments. Think bicycle wheel pot-holder instead of stainless steel appliances :) I'm a big traveler and collector of treasures, so you will find the apt decorated with an eclectic array of vintage furnishings! A decorative Victorian couch, a lobster pot for a coffee table, a ukulele for your use, and a s
description: This sunny West Town 2BR is a perfect place to call home after a day of exploring Chicago. Located on the top floor of a 3rd floor walk-up on a quiet residential street, just a few blocks away from bars, shops and restaurants. This apt is on the 3rd floor in the rear of building away from the street, so incredibly quiet and peaceful with tons of natural sunlight. High ceilings, large windows, vintage furnishings, open floor plan with two bedrooms, one off the kitchen with a twin bed and 2nd bedroom off of the living room with a queen bed. The apt can fit up to 3 people with 2 on the queen and 1 on the twin. There is an air mattress that fits in either twin room or living room should you need it.  ***NOTE: This is a prewar building, circa 1910 construction. Recent renovations have taken place, but the building and apt DO maintain their "vintage charm". Please advise if you are used to hotel stays or modern apartments. Think bicycle wheel pot-holder instead of stainless steel appliances
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet residential neighborhood, tucked a few blocks in on each side from 4 exciting main drags. Chicago ave a mere 3 blocks away has lots of great restaurants, bars, a homemade pie shop, library, walgreens, taco joints, boutiques etc . I've lived here 4 years after living in 3 other neighborhoods and it's by far my favorite. Very close to downtown and remarkably easy to get around via the bus system on all the main roads nearby.
notes: I've been hosting for 6 years and I am so happy to lend out my place to travelers and guests! I've had wonderful experiences with all of my guests, and am happy to answer any of your questions about myself or the space.
transit: The Chicago, Grand, Damen and Ashland buses are all frequent and a couple to a few blocks away. The Blue line is a 15 min walk away, I like to rely on the buses because they are so close and come every 5-8 minutes. There is free parking on the street if you drove. It is an easy jaunt from OHare on the Blue Line, I am happy to give you directions from either airport when you book. Cabs downtown run around $10, and cab to Ohare is about $40.
access: The entire apt is yours. The kitchen is well-stocked with amenities and you are welcome to use anything you require to make your stay more pleasant. *NOTE: This apartment is my home, therefore you will note that it is "lived in". I will clear drawers and closet space for your use, but be aware that cupboards and bathroom cabinets and bookshelves may contain personal items (nothing too personal, of course!)   The backyard is shared by the building's 5 other tenants. Please defer to them if you want to use the backyard.  They are all friendly and welcoming and happy to share the fire pit.
interaction: If I am out of town I will be reachable by cell or email, and will leave you the contact info of my neighbor should you need anything immediately during your stay. If I am in town, I will be nearby should anything occur or reachable by cell if you need to know the good coffee shop!
house_rules: Non Smoking No Cats Dogs--Talk to me
host_about:
Nice to meet you! I've been hosting in Chicago for the past 6 years and NYC for the past 2. I truly love opening my spaces to guests, and am always on hand for recommendations, a cup of coffee, or a chat. 

I'm a writer, actor, and professional organizer by trade(s). If you rent my place in NYC I'm sure we'll meet, if you rent in Chicago you'll meet my lovely co-host Kelsey. I'm a big traveler myself, some favorite destinations being Turkey, Berlin, Cuba, New Orleans, Montreal and Cambodia! 

Look forward to meeting you

name: Spacious + Convenient Logan Square One-bed Apt
space: Have you been hearing about the new "restaurant row" in Chicago's Logan Square? Stay steps away from culinary greatness in this warm and sun-drenched apartment. This spacious one-bedroom apartment includes a relatively new Casper queen-sized mattress. The large living room includes a comfortable couch for an additional sleeper, as well as a daybed.  A block from the California Blue Line stop, you'll be able to shuffle downtown in mere minutes.  The booming Logan Square restaurant and bar scene is a short walk from the front door.  Or, lounge in the sun-filled living room, use the desk and wi-fi to catch up on work, or sip some lemonade on the cute back deck.  Street parking is almost never a problem, though it is getting trickier in the evening. Also! Portions of the street ARE permit only--keep an eye out. This classic Chicago apartment will enhance your Chicago experience, as will the paintings and prints by local artists that line the walls.   The building is charming and well kept,
description: Have you been hearing about the new "restaurant row" in Chicago's Logan Square? Stay steps away from culinary greatness in this warm and sun-drenched apartment. This spacious one-bedroom apartment includes a relatively new Casper queen-sized mattress. The large living room includes a comfortable couch for an additional sleeper, as well as a daybed.  A block from the California Blue Line stop, you'll be able to shuffle downtown in mere minutes.  The booming Logan Square restaurant and bar scene is a short walk from the front door.  Or, lounge in the sun-filled living room, use the desk and wi-fi to catch up on work, or sip some lemonade on the cute back deck.  Street parking is almost never a problem, though it is getting trickier in the evening. Also! Portions of the street ARE permit only--keep an eye out. This classic Chicago apartment will enhance your Chicago experience, as will the paintings and prints by local artists that line the walls.   The building is charming and well kept,
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is the hottest Chicago neighborhood right now. I didn't make this up.
transit: The apartment is a very short walk to the California stop on the Blue Line. Additionally, there are scores of restaurants and bars within walking distance.
access: You'll have the full apartment!
interaction: I'll be available for any questions you might have. Texting is the best way to reach me.
house_rules: Guests are expected to treat the apartment as they would an aunt's or their mother's friend's house.  ( I hesitate to say your own friend's house, because, personally, I'm never particularly well-behaved at my good friends' houses.  Especially while on vacation.) The agreed upon number of guests is the limit.  If someone stops by for a glass of wine, it's no big deal. But, no parties, etc. There are plenty of places nearby for loud group revelry. Shoes should come off in the apartment. This is not a cleanliness issue; I'm not worried about little messes, etc.  But, shoes sound like thunder to the apartment dweller below. If something breaks, it's not a big deal.  I won't leave anything out that you'll need to worry about.  But, if it happens, please do let me know.
host_about:
Hi!

Originally from Omaha, NE, I've been living in Chicago for over a decade.

name: Vintage Ukrainian Village Apt!
summary: In the heart of charming Ukrainian Village and Wicker Park, third floor flat flooded with light.  Back garden and screened in balcony for summer days and nights.  Three bedrooms and two renovated bathrooms: large jacuzzi tub and steam shower.
space: A top (3rd) floor apartment in a historic Chicago brownstone with dazzling original woodwork from 1914 and new bathrooms, kitchen, heat/air conditioning.  The apartment has three bedrooms, a living room, dining room, kitchen, two baths (one with shower and one with Jacuzzi bath), washer/dryer, enclosed porch, garage space, and backyard with garden.  The apartment is located in the vibrant Wicker Park/Ukrainian Village neighborhood with shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars.  The street is a tree-lined, historic preservation neighborhood in Chicago.  One room is set up for a child or children.  The apartment is flooded with light and has beautiful views of the neighborhood. The apartment is right on the Division and Chicago bus lines that go downtown, two Blue Line “L” stops that go right to O’hare can be reached with a short walk or bus connection, a Zip-Car lot is a half block away. There is wireless internet, cable television, printer, fax, and couch that folds into a super comfortable
description: In the heart of charming Ukrainian Village and Wicker Park, third floor flat flooded with light.  Back garden and screened in balcony for summer days and nights.  Three bedrooms and two renovated bathrooms: large jacuzzi tub and steam shower. neighborhood_overview: Pedestrian friendly neighborhood filled with restaurants, cafes, and bars.  We love the fountain at Wicker Park, Sunday farmer's market, coffee at Cafe Streets, Mirai Sushi, The Empty Bottle for live music, and the trees and beautiful steeples on view from each window.  The Ukrainian Village/Wicker Park has the charm of a neighborhood and the high energy of the city.
notes: A quiet street minutes from many restaurants and venues.
transit: The Damen Blue Line stop goes to OHare and downtown and is a ten minute walk.  The 70 Division bus is a great artery to downtown, as is the 66 Chicago Ave bus.
access: Backyard garden, front porch, and full apartment.
interaction: Over email and as desired on their end.
house_rules: We cook a lot and have lots of cooking gear, help yourself, but please no cooking of pork with our pots, pans, and plates. You can smoke on the back porch, but not in the house. Please put drinks on coasters on all of the wood furniture.
host_about:
I am an actor and human beatbox based in Chicago.  I grew up in San Francisco and was raised in the Haight-Ashbury by a painter father and a violinist mother.  I have three one-person shows: MeTube, From Tel Aviv to Ramallah, and Sountrack City.  My wife, Rachel Havrelock, writes and directs my shows.  Since coming to Chicago, I've dedicated myself to the harmonica and to creating a new form of Hip-Hop Blues by fusing beatbox and harmonica.  I love traveling and bringing my musical form to people all over the world.

Rachel is a professor of English and Religious Stuides at the University of Illinois at Chicago.  She specializes in the Bible and the Middle East.  We have a four year old daughter.

I love cooking, making sushi, gardening, watching HBO, and live music.

name: Large, Private Logan Square Studio
summary: Your hideout in the City!  Cozy, large garden apartment with exposed brick, comfortable amenities and a fun vibe.  Completely private and a perfect, no-nonsense place to relax after enjoying the city and the electric Logan Square / Bucktown area. *** Now accepting longer term guests for the Winter months, ask for details***
space: Private, modern studio garden apartment in Logan Square.  Features and amenities include: - 650 square feet (60 m²) - Minutes from the CTA Blue Line and ample nightlife - Well-lit modern interior with modest natural light, cool exposed brick - Large modern bathroom with large shower, sink, toilet and vanity - Galley kitchen with microwave, fridge, gas oven / range, electric hot water kettle, coffee maker and kitchen basics (plates, cups, knives, forks and basic pots and pans & utensils) - Queen size bed that sleeps two (medium firm mattress) - Convertible futon / sofa bed that sleeps two, extra bedding provided - Central heating and air conditioning along with a space heater for extra warmth in the wintertime - Air purifier   - Free laundry - WiFi - Free on-street parking nearby - Well-lit private entrance - Basic furnishings (desk, two small sofas, dresser, closets, table, folding chairs, kitchen and bath essentials, coffee maker, small ironing board, bathroom vanity, clean towels, ex
description: Your hideout in the City!  Cozy, large garden apartment with exposed brick, comfortable amenities and a fun vibe.  Completely private and a perfect, no-nonsense place to relax after enjoying the city and the electric Logan Square / Bucktown area. *** Now accepting longer term guests for the Winter months, ask for details*** Private, modern studio garden apartment in Logan Square.  Features and amenities include: - 650 square feet (60 m²) - Minutes from the CTA Blue Line and ample nightlife - Well-lit modern interior with modest natural light, cool exposed brick - Large modern bathroom with large shower, sink, toilet and vanity - Galley kitchen with microwave, fridge, gas oven / range, electric hot water kettle, coffee maker and kitchen basics (plates, cups, knives, forks and basic pots and pans & utensils) - Queen size bed that sleeps two (medium firm mattress) - Convertible futon / sofa bed that sleeps two, extra bedding provided - Central heating and air conditioning along with a spa
neighborhood_overview: - Logan Square is an electric, eccentric mix of different ethnicities, hipsters, young families and young professionals - The neighborhood is widely regarded as one of Chicago's most up-and-coming cool places.  In 2013 it was voted 8th coolest in the country by Forbes for what it's worth  - There is something for everyone; great award winning restaurants, bars, live music, street festivals, a great  historic boulevard, a great farmers market and cool local boutiques.  There are many spots within a five minute walk - Nearby attractions include the Fireside Bowl (literally steps away), Logan Square Farmers’ Market which operates all year long, Historic Logan Boulevard and the hot Milwaukee Avenue Corridor - 5 minutes from Target and numerous supermarkets
notes: - Please make sure you review the house rules before you decide to book the apartment **DBA From Bad to Weerts, LLC**
transit: - Chicago is very bike friendly and is becoming more so everyday.  There is a bike share station five minutes from the apartment. - Less than five minute walk to the CTA Blue Line California ‘EL’ Stop - Via EL (Train/Metro):  15-20 minutes to Downtown Chicago; 35 minutes to O’Hare; 5 minutes to Wicker Park and Bucktown - Via Bus:  15-20 minutes to Lincoln Park and DePaul, bus is one half block away - On Foot:  Five minute walk or less to dozens of restaurants, bars and coffee shops
access: A keybox system allows you come and go as you please and does not require us to physically meet you in order to gain entry.  Arrival anytime after our posted check in time is fine by us!  See house rules for more details.
interaction: The apartment is completely private and is intended to be your private home in the city during your stay.  Feel free to use the outdoor patios, lawns and laundry room. We currently live offsite but are always available by phone and email in case of emergencies or if you have general questions.  Dylan, who lives on the second floor, keeps close watch of the place. For your convenience, we’ve left restaurant menus for you to review. There’s also a guidebook about the apartment that should answer most of your questions—but please ask if there’s anything you need to know! We are not overbearing hosts, but we’d love to help with restaurant and bar recommendations, ideas about what to see and do while you’re here, or any general questions that you have about your stay.  Welcome—and have a great stay!
house_rules: Welcome! We hope you have a pleasant stay in our home.  ***Please make sure you review the guidebook where we have left detailed notes on the best places in the neighborhood.  We tried to focus on places that we can personally vouch for as well as places located within a 5-20 minute walk.  Also please review the house guide located on the coffee table.*** Please note check in and check out times:  Important stuff you’ll need to know:  1) My friends Ellen and JD will be helping throughout your stay.  Their complete contact info (as well as mine) is located in the house guide on the coffee table.  Do not hesitate to call, text or email any of us if you run into problems or need advice with the neighborhood.  2) ACCESS.  The apartment is equipped with a key box so we don't need to be around to let you in.  One set of keys will be provided.  We will send you a detailed welcome message with the physical keybox code shortly before your stay. 3) Our friend Sandy helps us take care of the plac
host_about: Hello everyone!  I'm Jonathan and my friends JD, Ellen, Joey, Amanda and Mario have hosted on Airbnb since its introduction in Chicago.  We are proud of our city and our apartments and really want you to have a fabulous time during your stay with us.  We have attempted to create an easy low-key guest experience that really helps you feel like a local, plus providing the best bang for your buck, and and I hope we have achieved it!

name: Hostel Earphoria
summary: A long-standing interdisciplinary arts space in Chicago's Logan Square neighborhood.
space: Earphoria is a unique guesthouse in Logan Square Chicago that also functions as a community focused, interdisciplinary art space. We have transformed an entire house into an urban rest stop for musicians, artists, and lovers of the arts on the road, giving them a space to stay, play, practice, record, collaborate and perform. If you are looking for the formal experience you would enjoy in a hotel, Earphoria is not for you. We are for those that are more "adventure travel" oriented, who want to learn about the communities they pass through and be a part of the real Chicago arts scene.  Earphoria is a single family home that offers couch surfing spaces in a shared space and one bathroom. There is a community kitchen, living room, dining area, finished basement, back yard and deck.
description: A long-standing interdisciplinary arts space in Chicago's Logan Square neighborhood. Earphoria offers: - Complimentary bread, milk, eggs and condiments - Full Kitchen Access - Linens and Towels - Wi-Fi  - Free
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a dynamic, exciting neighborhood that is very walkable.
transit: Parking is easy, with non-permit parking available on the street. There is a CTA bus stop right outside our door and we are a 6 minute walk away from the Logan Square Blue Line stop.
access: Earphoria offers: - Complimentary bread, milk, eggs and condiments - Full Kitchen Access - Linens and Towels - Wi-Fi  - Free Washer and Dryer - Family style breakfasts and dinners are often cooked by hosts, friends and guests of Hostel Earphoria. New guests are encouraged to participate.  - We ask that each host and guest contribute by doing a daily chore.   - Gated parking available on request.
house_rules: - We ask that each guest does one chore a day. - During the week quiet hours begin at Midnight.  - During the weekend quiet hours begin at 2am
host_about:
Hi, my name is Jules Esh (you can find me online if you search) and I am the creator of Earphoria Music Collective.  Earphoria started as an AV podcast featuring interviews and acoustic sessions with musicians.  I realized that there was a need for shared living/playing space for musicians living in and traveling to cities. 

Earphoria's original location in Chicago, IL started in 2012 and is now a co-op which is overseen by a fantastic group of hosts involved in music, visual art, gardening, and community organizing.  You can find out more information by searching for Earphoria: Chicago.

In 2014 I moved to Austin, TX and started a second location.  I currently reside here with my family for most of the year.  There is a rotating group of musical guests and hosts that care for the space.  You can find more information by searching Earphoria: Austin.  

We hope to connect with you further!

host_about: We are a family of four, my husband Vince is a teacher and I am an artist, our two daughters are in college.  Our house is on the North side of Chicago, easy 20 minute trip by bus or train into downtown.  Between our house and downtown is Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo and several beaches.  In our neighborhood you will find great restaurants both award winning and ethnic (or both!), theaters, music venues and shopping within 5-15 minutes walking.  We love to eat out, hang out at the beach, go to see music in the local clubs and visit art shows around town.

summary: Large Bedroom with very comfortable King size bed on second floor next to a squeaky-clean, modern bathroom.   Perfect for visitors for Loyola or Northwestern University in Evanston.  You will feel at home here.  Sleeps one or two people.

neighborhood_overview: My home is located on a cute,  residential street of all single family homes. Some small to medium size multi unit buildings within a block or so. Quiet neighborhood.
notes: In summer, there  are ceiling fans and window Air Conditioning units in bedrooms, no central air.
transit: The Metra line is 3 blocks away.  Clark street bus #22 is a block away.    CTA Red Line is about a 15 minute walk, (Morse or Loyola closest stops).  Taxis are readily available.   Chicago also has Uber and Lyft car services.Perfect for people visiting Loyola or Northwestern Universities.
access: All guests are welcome to enjoy our home.   We provide organic coffee/tea, toast, butter, jam in the morning,  bottled water, bath towels, bed linens and WiFi.   Two flat screen TVs (with cable) are available to watch in kitchen area and Living Room.   Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Refrigerator and microwave ok to use.  Full kitchen use not allowed. A lovely, large outdoor deck is available in summer, fall to enjoy.
interaction: I live in the home with my partner.  We are quiet and will respect your privacy.  We both work daytime hours and are home in the evenings.   I will be there to greet you and assist with questions.  I will respect your privacy or love to visit - which ever you prefer.
house_rules: I accept respectful guests who will treat my home with care. Please No smoking, burning candles or incense in any room of the house.    Please NO eating in bedrooms.  Please Eat in the dining room and clean your own dishes. Please be clean in the bathroom, use the squeegee on shower glass after use.   No unauthorized guests to be brought back to home. Please try to be quiet when returning to the house if it's late in the evening.   Please remove shoes when entering the house.  Thank you.
host_about:
I love travelling and meeting other travellers.  I can make your stay in my city a little bit more comfortable and leave a nice impression of Midwest hospitality.  I just want my guests to know I am sincere and provide a clean, safe, comfortable space to re-charge for the next day's adventures.
I am a graduate of the University of Illinois in Business Administration and own a floral and event company in Chicago.

name: Private Lincoln Square Garden Apt
summary: Clean and comfortable one-bedroom garden apartment with kitchenette in a vintage brick building. Sleeps 2-4 comfortably (queen bed and futon or air mattress). Pleasant and lively neighborhood and a short walk to the train.
space: Garden apartment with private entry, one bedroom, bathroom, and kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, fridge, but no stove). Very fun and walkable neighborhood. Old Town School of Folk Music, Lincoln Square shopping/restaurants, grocery store, nearby train and bike sharing stations, parks, and more.   There is no central air conditioning, but it generally stays comfortable even in warm months; however, we do provide a portable air conditioner for the hot months.  Of interest to families with youngsters, there is a little play area and toys under the stairs (Kids love it), a fun tree swing out front in the parkway, tree house, a little free library, and a couple of nearby playgrounds. Full disclosure/Heads up!: Garden apartment = basement. It is has windows and good natural light in all rooms, but windows are glass block w/ small windows to open for fresh air. Also, the ceiling height is about 7.5', but there is a center beam that puts it as low as 6'1", so taller folks beware.
description: Clean and comfortable one-bedroom garden apartment with kitchenette in a vintage brick building. Sleeps 2-4 comfortably (queen bed and futon or air mattress). Pleasant and lively neighborhood and a short walk to the train. Garden apartment with private entry, one bedroom, bathroom, and kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, fridge, but no stove). Full disclosure/Heads up!: Garden apartment = basement. It is has windows a
neighborhood_overview: In our humble opinion, this is one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago. It's lively, fun and one of the safest in the city. The shootings in Chicago are concentrated in the south and west side neighborhoods; it can and does happen in all neighborhoods, but victims are almost always gang-involved. Within three blocks we have: independent coffee shop,  an L station with cool crossing signals, two bike share stations, two restaurants with excellent patio areas, award-winning Goosefoot (Website hidden by Airbnb) Harvestime (eclectic, independent grocery store), bike/walking path along Chicago River, Bloom Yoga studio. Within 6-8 blocks: River Park w/ public pool, Waters School (w/natural prairie and community gardens), Chicago Printmakers Collaborative (open on Saturdays) and tons of stuff in Lincoln Square. There's almost always something happening in Lincoln Square; check out the Chamber of Commerce events calendar: (Website hidden by Airbnb)
notes: There is no stove for cooking. The buzzer for the apartment does not work, so be advised if you're having visitors or food delivered. Also the shower door needs a bit of lift to close properly.  Safety: The apartment has a CO detector (on shelf above kitchen sink) and first aid kit (in bathroom medicine cabinet)
transit: Downtown/Loop is 45 minutes on the brown line el, (we are very close to the Rockwell stop). Parking is on-street and free. It is usually easy to find a spot, but does get trickier in the evening after 6:00p.m. CTA brown line is a great way to get downtown and to many neighborhoods in between.  Uber/Lyft/taxi are good options during non-rush hours.
access: All amenities in the apartment, including wi-fi. The front yard/bench/picnic table. We also have a pack-n-play and a booster seat for little ones. Washer/dryer by arrangement only. Periodic cleaning service upon request (for longer stays). The laundry/work/storage area is shared with our neighbors so this area is private access or with permission only.
interaction: Not much interaction. I try to meet guests when they first arrive and chat a bit, but I pretty much stay out of the way. Guests can usually check themselves in, when arranged in advance. I always like bumping into guests outside the apartment in or in the neighborhood, but prefer not to interrupt their stay.
house_rules: For the comfort of future guests, absolutely no smoking or pets. Be good neighbors! Our upstairs neighbors (Bruce and Sarah) are very courteous; please try not to make much noise. Let me know if you need anything or if you have any questions. Check in is after 5:00  Check out is before 11:00 a.m. (Just lock the door and drop the key through the mail slot.)
host_about: My family of four lives in the top unit of the two-flat. We spend a lot of time walking or biking around in our neighborhood (we happily have no car). You can often find us out front, sitting on the bench, swinging  from the tree, or just chatting with neighbors. We love visiting other cities where we can stay in interesting neighborhoods without the hassle of needing a car. We think our place is well-suited for others  who appreciate urban neighborhoods.

name: Perfect Lincoln Park home in a great location!
summary: This house is ideal for a weekend visit or long stay.   Every amenity is at your fingertips and every Chicago site is steps away/train away.  Great modern space with eat-in chefs kitchen updated comfortable bathrooms and spacious city backyard.
space: Perfect Lincoln Park location for a Chicago getaway!!!  Heart of Lincoln Park  and the edge of Old Town. This home away from home is larger than it seems with ample space to have family gatherings in the living room and a large wall-mounted TV to watch Chicago's world championship teams.   the game Loads of restaurants, shops and sightseeing. Just a couple blocks to the zoo, few more to the lakefront for biking, running, rollerblading, walking & sunning! (you can take the dogs in the morning before 9:30am). Buses on the corner for a trip downtown or up to Wrigley (10min cab ride to either). Close enough to stroll on the Gold Coast and Michigan Ave.  Steps from 3 CTA lines (Purple, Brown, & Red)  to quickly take you to Buckingham fountain or wherever your heart desires - including all of the free and fun festivals Chicago offers.   Easily accessible to both O'hare and Midway airports and cabs plentiful.  Ideal location for relatives visiting from out of town who want the amenities of th

neighborhood_overview: What is there not to love.  On the edge of 2 great neighborhoods, Lincoln Park and Old Town, there is plenty to see, eat and do.  Whether it's riding a rental 'Divvy' bike to the lake (3 Divvy stations within 2 blocks), walking to Michelin rated restaurants, or catching a game - it is literally within blocks (or a few miles).  Its the best of what the city has to offer with the conveniences of home.
transit: Oh my, public transportation is plentiful.  Within blocks of 3 El stations (Red, Brown, & Purple lines) which can take you anywhere in the city.  Moreover, don't worry about cabs, they are easy to hail at the corner.  Now with the new rental bikes - Divvy bikes, you can easily cruise the city.
access: This is truly a home away from home.  You have access to the private front courtyard and the private city backyard.  The backyard has seating for family eating and a grill for your pleasure.
interaction: We are here to ensure satisfaction with the accommodations and the house.  Please feel free to reach out to us prior, during or after your stay.
house_rules: Since this is a home away from home - please treat it as such.  Though it is a private backyard, the neighbors can hear elevated voices.  So please be considerate and respectful.  If you use the backyard, please clean up - empty the trash in the front bins.    We are in the city and trying to minimize on or furry four legged neighbors.  Smoking is ONLY  permitted outside.  There are No parties on this property.
host_about:
I'm in love with traveling and exploring real and authentic life in the 4 corners of the world.  

Not a native of Chicago, I love the lake, the food scene (and dare I say it twice) the food scene.  There is much to do and explore amd I continually find something new to learn.

name: Groovy on the Lake  private bd/bth
summary: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. Magical bedroom w full bath can sleep three. Perfect for kids, lovely for grownups, too. Promise, it's all good.
space: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour doorstaff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier.  Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe.  The kid's room has one twin bed with a Tempurpedic topper under the loft). My room has a totally dreamy king-size pillow top bed, the same kind they use at the Four Seasons. Both bedrooms have full bathrooms.  Our pad is walking distance to the Lincoln Park Zoo, Wri
description: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. Magical bedroom w full bath can sleep three. Perfect for kids, lovely for grownups, too. Promise, it's all good. Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour doorstaff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.
notes: There's a Divvy bike station right outside my building. If the weather's nice, grab a bike and ride downtown along the lake or explore any of Chicago's great neighborhoods.
transit: Hop a five minute cab or the 146 express buss to downtown and the loop right out our front door. The Belmont stop El train (brown/red line) is a ten minute walk away. Hail a cab right out front in minutes. Parking is a big drag in my neighborhood, so skip the rental car. I don't own a car and happily get around on foot, cab, or bus. If you are driving, there's street parking and  a public lot just a block away (Broadway and Roscoe).
interaction: Happy to point you in the right direction!
house_rules: No pets, no smoking.  As much as we love fun and games, no parties or extra guests who are not listed in the original booking. Please --no shoes in the house --please refrain from wearing strong perfumes and colognes  --use place mats on the dining room table, especially for water glasses --Before leaving, please change the sheets and towels and empty the garbage. Be nice.
host_about: author + artist + social entrepreneur + community activist.

name: Sweet Ivy #2 Loft Apartment with Private Terrace!
summary: Welcome to the Sweet Ivy House! Enormous & sunny 2nd floor 2 bedroom + office/loft apartment with private outdoor terrace located in trendy Ukrainian Village neighborhood! Easy access to neighborhood shops, grocery, restaurants, Divvy bikes, Metra, CTA bus & trains to downtown and other exciting Chicago neighborhoods!
space: FANTASTIC PRICE FOR PRIVATE 2 LEVEL, 2 BEDROOM PLUS DEN AND ROOF DECK APARTMENT! Perfect for a couple or 2 roommates. Super Ukrainian Village location.  Please read full description below to save us both time consuming emails. If you use the bonus word in your inquiry you will get a more favorable response! Preference given to experienced Airbnb guests especially with great reviews!  Rent your own private apartment! Incredible kitchen with stainless steel appliances and all utensils and supplies included.  Charming terrace off the kitchen, al fresco dining under ivy covered pergola. neighborhood_overview: The property is located in the Ukrainian Village neighborhood, which is surrounded by cafes, grocery shopping and wonderful neighborhood culture.
notes: ***REVIEW UPDATE*** Dear Traveler, after years of hosting to fantastic and responsible guests who respected my property, I had my first ever negative experience with a group who turned my house into a party place, damaged personal property and disturbed the neighbors. Fortunately, Airbnb mediated the claim.  In retaliation, the guest left a negative review. All the other reviews are positive, and there are NO issues with the wifi, tv or internet. Thank you!
transit: 4 block walk to #66 bus on Chicago Avenue to Chicago's downtown or connect to blue line train.  1 .5 block walk to Grand Avenue #65 bus to Navy Pier/downtown.  About a mile to the blue line train. The Metra train is 4 blocks away and  only takes 8 minutes downtown to Union Station.  There is also a divvy bike share station a block and a half away that rents for $10 per day.
access: Free laundry in basement, Free yoga mats, tennis rackets, picnic baskets and chairs, fresh linens and cleaning supplies, and your own private outdoor terrace.  Host storage cabinets off limits.
interaction: Initial orientation in person to answer questions and show property, afterwards available via email and text. Owner and staff visit property occasionally for maintenance. Extra attention provided to international guests.
house_rules: No unregistered overnight guests without prior host approval.  Please turn off appliances, heat, fans and lights, lock doors and windows when you leave the house.  Check out is 12 noon but is flexible if our schedule permits, possible luggage storage. We want you to have fun, but also respect our property and neighbors. Thank you and please enjoy your stay!
host_about:
Hi, I look forward to meeting you! 
***Update: please note that after years of hosting amazing, incredible people, I had my first unfortunate group of guests who turned my home into a party house, disturbed the neighbors and damaged my possessions. Fortunately, airbnb mediated the claim. In retaliation, the guest posted my one and only negative review.  Please be assured there are no issues with the cable and internet! ***
I'm an entrepreneur, world traveler, foodie, yoga fan but don't do it as much as I should, collegiate fencer, Australian Shepherd Frisbee Champion Trainer, Italy Enthusiast, and love sailing on the waters of beautiful lake Michigan. I'm a low key, drama free individual, and will give you your private independent space, but am there to help you with any questions to make your stay more comfortable!

name: Logan Square Modern Vintage Garden
summary: This two-bedroom, cozy ground-level flat with a newly renovated bathroom is a great base from which to explore Logan Square's restaurants, coffee houses and farmers market. It's a perfect point of departure for Chicago's sites and attractions.
space: :: Hi there and welcome to my listing! :: It's my sixth year of being an AirBNB host, and I can't wait to share Chicago with you! A newly renovated bathroom and full kitchen await you, and the Logan Square neighborhood just keeps getting better and better. Get yourself over here! :: Important basics :: - Accommodates four people maximum, but can be COZY for four adults. - In summer, a window unit air conditioner cools the place down. - Yes, towels are provided. - No dishwasher. - No pets. No exceptions.  - On-street PARKING is easily available and free (it requires a neighborhood permit which is provided). - Again, it is an English Garden apartment AT GROUND LEVEL so it doesn't get a ton of sunlight, but large windows and good light fixtures work to combat that. :: The Place :: It is an English Garden apartment (ground level) in a vintage 3-flat; I live two floors above. The apartment is decorated in a fun vintage modern style with comfort and function foremost. It combines historic ch

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in Logan Square. It's one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, boasting gorgeous boulevards. Family-friendly amenities are balanced by a thriving nightlife scene with cocktail bars, gastropubs, late night eateries, and live music.
notes: :: Guests We Like :: The guests we like are respectful, tread-lightly types who are easy to get a hold of, can follow a couple of simple rules, and clean up after themselves. They are not put off by an urban environment and generally appreciate the arts, culture and good food. They hang wet towels to dry, do not leave a sink full of dirty dishes and  leave a review shortly after their stay.   *** Please do not make a reservation request until you have completed your profile, including a photo and verifications. That is part of what makes AirBNB a "community," as opposed to staying at a hotel. As well, it gives the hosts a better level of security as we are letting people into our homes and on to our private property. Much appreciated. ***
transit: - 10-minute walk to/from the Logan Square Blue Line el station - 40-minute train ride from O'Hare  - 25-minute train ride to downtown
access: You are welcome to enjoy the front patio and a shared backyard with Weber Grill/BBQ.
interaction: :: The "Hotelier" :: I live upstairs in a separate apartment and am available for anything you need (directions, recommendations, etc.), but I will generally be invisible unless you need me. Honestly, I just want this to be a cool and accommodating getaway for visitors who wish to experience Chicago as a local would!
house_rules: •Check in: 3 pm. There is a lock box, so you may let yourself in upon arrival anytime after 3 pm. Please call or text me so I know you have arrived and all is well. After 10:30 pm, please text only. •Check out: 11 am. Please call or text me to confirm you have departed. •Cigarette smoking is allowed on the front patio or back yard. No smoking inside the apartment. Please do not empty ashtrays inside the building. •No pets please.
host_about:
Midwestern urban farm girl who appreciates art, architecture, travel, good food and good friends. I wear many hats, among them interior decorator, writer, corporate marketing veteran, vintage/antique dealer and landlord. I've owned my Logan Square property for more than 11 years and have lived in Chicago on and off for the last 25 with a stint in Washington, DC. I am excited to welcome fellow travelers who like to explore "off the beaten path" and proud to welcome them into my home, which is my pride and joy.  

My personal recent travels include a long weekend in Detroit, some great hiking in Park City, Utah, a very long break on Kauai and some urban fun in NYC.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of one of Chicago's oldest historic districts with gorgeous brown/gray stone houses and mansions. Its is also  0.6-miles from the lake or approximately 10-20 minutes walk depending on your pace. There are trails along the lake for running, biking or just strolling. And of course there is a marina and beach nearby on 31st and Oakwood  It is also the home of Chicago's Famous Chicken & Waffle Restaurant.
transit: Getting around on CTA buses and trains is easy. The #3 bus stops right in-front of the building and you can take it to and from downtown Chicago. There is also the Green Line train which is (5-blocks away  about 10-15 minutes walk.
house_rules: The Apartment:  This is a fully furnished condo/apartment, so please make yourself at home away from home.  1.) No Pets: Pets  are not allowed and no loud music...Therefore this is not a place to have a party. 2.) No Smoking: Smoking is not allowed inside the unit or the building, but if you must, please do it outside the building. 3.) Not Childproof or Children Friendly: The condo/apartment is not childproof  or children friendly, however if you have a child or children they must be supervised. 4.) Kitchen& Pantry:  Help yourself to the  cookware, plates, drinking glasses, cups etc in the cabinets. Feel free to use the condiments, spices, food  etc in the pantry.  Avail yourself to juice, water or whatever you see in the refrigerator and food pantry. However, please clean up after yourself. 5.) Towels / Linens:  There are extra towels and wash rags in the bathroom closet and linens in the bedroom closet if you need them. Please put the dirty ones in the hamper.  6.) Heat AC/Central Ai
host_about: I'm into sports, travelling,  and meeting people from different places

name: Drop-dead fab on the Lake  2bd/2bth
summary: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. Promise, it's all good.
space: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour doorstaff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier.  Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe.  The kid's room has one twin bed with a Tempurpedic topper. My room has a totally dreamy king-size pillow top bed, the same kind they use at the Four Seasons. Both bedrooms have full bathrooms.  Our pad is walking distance to the Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field, muse
description: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. Promise, it's all good. Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour doorstaff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe.  The kid's room has one tw
neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.
notes: There's a Divvy bike station right outside my building. If the weather's nice, grab a bike and ride downtown along the lake or explore any of Chicago's great neighborhoods.
transit: Hop a five minute cab or the 146 express buss to downtown and the loop right out our front door. The Belmont stop El train (brown/red line) is a ten minute walk away. Hail a cab right out front in minutes. Parking is a big drag in my neighborhood, so skip the rental car. I don't own a car and happily get around on foot, cab, or bus. If you are driving, there's street parking and  a public lot just a block away (Broadway and Roscoe).
interaction: Sometimes will be staying nearby, sometimes not. If we're in town, we're happy to share a meal, leave you alone, or point you in the right direction.
house_rules: No pets, no smoking.  As much as we love fun and games, no parties or extra guests who are not listed in the original booking. --no shoes in the house --please refrain from wearing strong perfumes and colognes  --use place mats on the dining room table, especially for water glasses --Before leaving, please change the sheets and towels and empty the garbage. Be nice.
host_about: author + artist + social entrepreneur + community activist.

name: Spacious Bedroom, steps to El train
summary: Very private room at Montrose Brown line El stop. (map that to see if it’s your ideal area) in a VERY spacious and lovely home. Easy street parking, or parking spot available for a fee! Seconds from bus! Downtown in 22 minutes! Early/late check-in/out available. LGBTQ welcoming. The train is nearby so I have earplugs for you if you’re not used to the city sounds :)
space: It has a fun artsy feel, is beautifully decorated, and is always described by guests as very peaceful!  Keep in mind that it's a 3BR apt. I stay in my den if all 3 rooms are full. **Must be okay with the other rooms being rented out** (even though it’s rare that I have separate parties occupying my apartment) and sharing bathroom as well. It is a shared space, not a private apt :)  Because of a dozen past experiences: I have stopped allowing guests to drink in my home. Also, no additional guests inside my home aside from the ones listed on the reservation.  Beds: (You have a choice between rooms, on a first-come first-served basis if the others aren’t spoken for. I very RARELY host more than one party at a time) Room 1- one queen bed Room 2- one king bed, 2 pull outs Room 3- one queen bed  Additional beds that can be added to any room: one twin rollaway bed (comfortable), endless queen & twin airbeds as needed. STORAGE: Bathroom... You may store your toiletries on the metal shelf near

neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with tree-lined streets and a lot of beautiful single family houses, and a 30 second walk to the train.
notes: Must be comfortable with a dog in the house! He's very small and keeps to himself.  If I'm not home, he is *ALWAYS either with me or he stays in my bedroom with the door shut. He will never bother you.
transit: 1 minute walk to Montrose Brown line AND #78 & #50 bus (straight shot to wicker park)! Very cheap taxi from O'hare! The most I've ever paid, including tip, is $36. Usually it's $32. Whereas uber is about $10 cheaper.
access: Everything! Except the other bedroom near the kitchen. That's mine and off limits :)   Guests are free to have full access to kitchen, guest living room, bathroom. Make yourself at home! Come and go as you please.  ...I'd just prefer to host guests that aren't home all day every day...
interaction: I'm home during the day and gone past midnight most nights. I'm happy to answer any questions! But tend to make myself scarce :) Don't worry about waking me up in the morning! You won't disturb me, promise.
house_rules: -Leave the place as you found it. (No dirty dishes, no food left in fridge, make beds, if you track in beach sand it is your responsibility to sweep it up.) -Take your shoes off. -No playing music.  Here are the basics, most of them are just common sense but need to be stated anyway :) ... 1. Quiet time is from 11:59pm – 8:00am. Please respect neighbors during these hours. (No loud music/talking/disturbance) NO  TALKING ON THE STAIRS ON THE WALK UP TO THE APARTMENT EVER. Once inside, you are free to talk as much as you want of course. 2. No guests are allowed in the apartment other than those who are listed in the initial Airbnb confirmation at any time during your stay. Not anyone, not for any reason. 3. No Pets, other than the host's, will be allowed inside premises during guest's stay. Unless otherwise agreed upon beforehand. 4. No drug use or smoking in the apartment or around the apartment (this includes the porch). 5. Premises are to be left in the same condition as they were fou
host_about:
I am a comedian who moved here from Seattle a couple years ago.
In Seattle I was actually a dog trainer and fitness boot camp instructor, and a comedian on the side-- so I decided to flip that script! I have a small well behaved dog (12 lbs) and I love to laugh!

host_about: Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

name: Stylish, comfortable room in nice Duplex
summary: The Airbnb room was just completely renovated, new flooring, paint, furniture and bedding :)
space: Great neighborhood !! West Lakeview, a very safe neighborhood on the Northside of Chicago. Just a two minute walk to Hamlin Park and 5 minutes to Roscoe Village, known for its restaurants, shops and coffee shops.  On the corner of either the Damen (N/S) or Diversey (E/W) bus lines. 15 min car ride to downtown Chicago. My preferred guests for my Airbnb guest room on the garden level of my duplex apartment are college students, professionals and tourists.  The room dimensions are 11x12". You will have a full private closet and a full private bathroom at your disposal right next to your room, also a private entrance that leads straight to your room. The apartment is new, modern yet comfortable in design. There's an entrance on each level for added privacy so we aren't constantly walking through each others' lives.  The available room contains all needed furniture: bed, dresser, bookshelf, lounge chair, table, desk, mirror, small refrigerator etc.  Bed sheets and towels will be provided. Y

name: The Stained Glass Apt. Edgewater #1
space: *Attention to first time users of Airbnb* This is not a private apartment for rent. I live here and I also have another smaller room listed on the site! My apartment is on the third floor of a three flat brick building on a quiet tree lined street in Edgewater. It was built 1916 in Prairie style featuring high ceilings, amazing woodwork and stained glass all of which have been restored. I'm a big fan of flea markets and antique stores so my home is filled with beautiful curiosities. My friend calls it "The museum" but don't let that scare you :) The place has a really comfy and peaceful vibe. It is spacious and open in the way that one can stand at one end of the apartment and see through to the other end. There is an enclosed sunporch in the front of the house which offers a serene view of the tops of trees. The bedroom I can offer has a comfortable double bed and a most prized Eastlake antique dresser with egyptian pharaoh head drawer pulls. There is one shared bathroom in the apartm
description: *Attention to first time users of Airbnb* This is not a private apartment for rent. I live here and I also have another smaller room listed on the site! My apartment is on the third floor of a three flat brick building on a quiet tree lined street in Edgewater. neighborhood_overview: The location is really prime as it's approximately a 4 1/2 block walk (roughly 8 minutes) to either Granville or Loyola redline train stations as well as 6 blocks to the lake. The neighborhood is really lovely and down right lush with trees and flowers (when weather permits)  Although Edgewater is a 30-45 minute train ride downtown, there is something to be said for staying here and getting a taste of a real Chicago neighborhood. Staying downtown is great in many ways but it is the typical tourist view and you will not experience  what I consider to be the real heart of Chicago where the regular folks live. There are two antique malls, a couple of great coffee houses and restaurants all a short walk away.
notes: Please let me know if you intend on bringing a vehicle. There is permit parking on my street so depending on the duration of your stay, we would need to discuss the options! If you are a smoker but intent on smoking outside the apartment please know that this can be problematic. There are three units in this building and none of my neighbors smoke so it's not okay to smoke in the hallway or in the back yard. It is also not a good thing if you intend to smoke just before you enter the house.  I'm extremely sensitive/ allergic. So pretty much the only way it's going to work is if you are a light smoker do not smoke anywhere near my house!
access: Guest are welcome to use the kitchen and refrigerator. You are welcome to hang out in the living room as well. My back porch studio is my private space.  There is one shared bathroom.
house_rules: I would ask that my guests come in and out quietly after 10:00 pm. Also would so appreciate opening and closing doors to bathroom and bedroom quietly after 10:00! No illegal downloading of movies etc. Believe it or not, the internet provider will know and threaten to cancel my service! Please respect the antique furniture: use coasters for drinks and beware of things that might scratch surfaces or get the wood wet.  If you are a smoker but intend on smoking outside the apartment please know that this can be problematic. There are three units in this building and none of my neighbors smoke so it's not okay to smoke in the hallway or in the back yard. It is also not a good thing if you intent to smoke just before you enter the house.  I'm extremely sensitive/ allergic. So pretty much the only way it's going to work is if you are a light smoker do not smoke anywhere near my house!  Do not bring anyone else into my apartment without asking.   Do not forget to return the keys. Thanks!
host_about:
I am currently on a new path=which really means I lost my job and I want to try something different. I have done quite a bit of international travel and hope to do a lot more. I love people. I am an artist, card maker and writer. I am obsessed with postcards. I'm really in love with Chicago and although I've lived here my whole life I continue to discover new treasure!

Some things that I love: Writing, reading, bicycling, coffee, trying different types of food, yoga, movies, old cemeteries, art museums, photography, vintage postcards, pen pals, architecture, antique markets, folk art, tiles, decorative metal, wine, beer, and a well crafted cocktail and of course,  traveling!!!

I believe good things can come from seemingly bad things: the symbolic opening of a new door. 

I strive to be present, recognize beauty, project love, and be extremely grateful for my life.  Each person I meet reinforces my belief in a world full of love and kindness and every new friend makes it a better place.  Traveling has been my most valuable education. 

Places I have traveled: Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Kenya, Mexico, Monaco, Morocco, Netherlands, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Scotland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, Wales

name: Designer Lakeview Haven. Walk to Wrigley Field!
summary: Beautiful 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath condo on tree lined street in charming Lakeview. Only a 2 minute walk to the Paulina Brown line stop and 20 minute walk to Wrigley Field, I’m nestled between the Southport Corridor and Roscoe Village. Short walk to Starbucks, Target, Walgreens, Whole Foods and multiple restaurants and bars. Hop on the train and be downtown in 20 minutes. I have 3 floors of bright and spacious living with a gorgeous furnished rooftop with city views.
space: This is my dream home. My condo has 3 floors of living space with the main floor offering a bright and open living room, dining room, kitchen and two balconies. The second floor consists of 2 master suits with en suite bathrooms. One of the suites has a private balcony. My private rooftop offers an entire outdoor living space with city views. I have Amazon Echo and Netflix in the Living Room for your entertainment. My Amazon Music subscription will play any type of background music you would like. I also have a Bluetooth “Harmon Kardon” portable speaker for the rooftop.

neighborhood_overview: My condo is in the heart of Lakeview, the most comfortable neighborhood in Chicago. I live within one block of the Paulina brown line train stop, Starbucks, City Target, Frasca Italian Restaurant, Fernando’s Mexican Restaurant, Brown Bag Seafood and Waterhouse Bar and Grill. This neighborhood is VERY safe! Southport Corridor- (bars, restaurants, J-Crew, Gap, Bonobos, Soul Cycle, boutique shopping)- 10 minute walk Roscoe Village (bars, restaurants, boutiques)- 5 minute walk Wrigley Field- 20 minute walk Boystown- 20 minute walk
notes: This is my permanent home. Please treat it as your own. I hope you love it as much as I do. No Bachelor or Bachelorette Gatherings. No more than 6 people in my home if you’re entertaining.   Registration # R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: Chicago Brown line stop and divvy bike station within one block. 20 minute train ride to the Loop. Ubers and Lyfts typically take 3-5 minutes to arrive to my home. Lyft- use code “FLYCHI” for up to $25 in credits for new riders. Very walkable family friendly neighborhood.
access: Entire Home.
interaction: Always available via phone or text. If I am out of the country my realtor will be available.
house_rules: - Please remove shoes when inside.  - Max of 4 people staying unless you have Owner approval. - If entertaining; no more than 6 people total in the home. - Smoking is okay outside on balconies and rooftop.
host_about: I Love staying at airbnbs throughout the world, but I especially love sharing my Chicago home with Airbnbers.

name: Large Double Queen Studio Apartment in Wicker Park
summary: This large studio apartment features two queen beds, full kitchen, en suite bathroom and private entrance. Centrally located on our quiet, tree-line street just a block from restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. A true city gem!
space: This large studio apartment is located on the lower level of a historic home.  It includes 2 queen-sized beds, full eat-in kitchen, and private bath.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field.
description: This large studio apartment features two queen beds, full kitchen, en suite bathroom and private entrance. Centrally located on our quiet, tree-line street just a block from restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. A true city gem! This large studio apartment is located on the lower level of a historic home.  It includes 2 queen-sized beds, full eat-in kitchen, and private bath.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field. Our studio apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private. We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun. Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Fiel
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field or a show at the United Center.  The apartment is centrally located and close to many popular spots in Chicago.  Come stay and live like a local!
notes: We offer secure parking and a full breakfast each morning at the B&B. Ask about adding these amenities to your reservation for an additional fee.
transit: We are blocks away from the nearest train station and a block from the Milwaukee Ave bus.  Both take you directly into downtown.  You can also rent a Divvy bike or electric scooter or request an Uber, Lyft or hail a cab.  A car is not needed to get around town.
access: Our studio apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.
interaction: We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.
house_rules: Since we are in a residential area, we ask our guests to to respect our neighbors and other guests.  We kindly request that quiet hours be observed between the hours of 9:00pm and 6:00am.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

name: Edgebrook Lg bdr by golf course
space: Stay in one of two bedrooms in a quiet, upscale Edgebrook house across from the Billy Caldwell public golf course.  This is larger bedroom of the two and is furnished with a queen size bed with a desk and large close space, great for extended stay or just a short visit or a few days of golf across the street.  There is ample street parking and two parking ports available for your use. I occupy the lower floor of the home and we will share the kitchen.   There is one bathroom for the two rooms for rent and you will have to share it if both rooms are rented. You will have use of the living room/dining room furnished with flat screen tv and cable and wi-fi.  The kitchen is modern complete with stainless steel appliances and dishwasher and there are laundry machines available for use downstairs.  Relax in the backyard with lawn chairs and tables when the weather is nice.  Basic breakfast will be included for stays one week or less. This house is just 10 miles northwest of downtown Chicago,

house_rules: This is a shoe-less home so please leave shoes by the door.  Put dirty dishes in the dishwasher and keep things generally clean.  Other than that, it's a relaxed atmosphere, just keep things tidy/clean in the common area that we will share.
host_about:
I am a professional violinist, art curator, small business owner, and a lover of all things creative.  I've traveled to Europe, Middle East, Russia, Mexico, and all over North America and love meeting people from different cultures. 

Originally from Taiwan, I grew up in Seattle and moved to Chicago in 1995 and have been here ever since.  I know the ins and outs of Chicago and can point you to some of the best things to see around the city and some of the out of the way places only locals know.  I am very easy going and love to entertain so you'll be sure to have a pleasant and fun stay while you are in town.

name: Bedrm/Bath - Swanky Northside Condo.
summary: A combination of home-style generosity and orderly AirBnB protocols will welcome you to the Far North Side with Michael and Rox.
space: Attractively appointed ground-floor bedroom and bathroom are all yours in a large new condo owned and occupied by a playful couple -- a freelance professional (journalist/professor/former concierge) and her well-read husband Michael.  FREE wifi, satellite TV (in room), laundry in unit, street parking.  Great for persons using a car or those willing to take a bus a few minutes' walk from the house to get to a variety of trains/buses, or walk one mile to numerous transport lines going south to downtown or north to the North Shore suburbs. Use of kitchen and great room would be shared with hosts.   Central a/c and heat. Target store with full grocery 1/2 block away. Richly cultural Pakistani/Indian commercial strip a short walk away on Devon Avenue.  The place is actually NOT in Rogers Park technically and definitely not "West Rogers Park" as the auto-fill says.  It's a neighborhood of apartment buildings, homes, and tree-lined streets. ............................................ Roxane
description: A combination of home-style generosity and orderly AirBnB protocols will welcome you to the Far North Side with Michael and Rox. Attractively appointed ground-floor bedroom and bathroom are all yours in a large new condo owned and occupied by a playful couple -- a freelance professional (journalist/professor/former concierge) and her well-read husband Michael.  FREE wifi, satellite TV (in room), laundry in unit, street parking.  Great for persons using a car or those willing to take a bus a few minutes' walk from the house to get to a variety of trains/buses, or walk one mile to numerous transport lines going south to downtown or north to the North Shore suburbs. Use of kitchen and great room would be shared with hosts.   Central a/c and heat. Target store with full grocery 1/2 block away. Richly cultural Pakistani/Indian commercial strip a short walk away on Devon Avenue.  The place is actually NOT in Rogers Park technically and definitely not "West Rogers Park" as the auto-fill says.
neighborhood_overview: This sleepy tree-lined area near Lake Michigan is 1/2 block from Target (with Starbuck's within).  Another mile puts you in trendy Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, or even closer to the north, Devon Avenue for Pakistani/Indian fare and shopping.  Due east is Lake Michigan with the CTA Red Line running constantly to downtown through many fun areas along the way: Uptown, Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Lincoln Park.  It's a 10-minute bus or taxi ride through a mostly residential area to the Red Line station in bustling Edgewater.  You can also pick up a Divvy bike at the Target 1/2 block from the house and ride to the nearest CTA Red Line station (Bryn Mawr) docking the bike near there.  Walking to the Red Line takes about 20 minutes.  Suburban Chicago is a short drive away -- Lincolnwood and Skokie to the west and Evanston to the north.
notes: **ID will be required at check-in for each individual who will be staying in the lodging, regardless of who booked the space.**.............LONG STAYS and GUESTS JUST BEGINNING TO STRIKE OUT ON THEIR OWN IN LIFE: A conversation about how the kitchen functions smoothly for sharing should happen when concentration is good and details are absorbed with sincerity.  Rule of thumb about clean-up: Leave nothing but the smell.  Cookware should be washed by hand and put back in place.  Dishes in dishwasher.  Stovetop and microwave as you found them.  Sinks, counters, cutting boards cleaned, sanitizing every surface touched by chicken or liquids from chicken packaging. If you drip oil, sauce, batter, milk, water on the floor or down the front of the cabinets, clean it. ..........................................Ask for specifics about what goods are free to use up and what you should replace.  Guests are asked to let us know when something runs out, not just discard the empty container...........
transit: This sleepy tree-lined area near Lake Michigan is 1/2 block from Target (with Starbuck's within).  Another mile puts you in trendy Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, or even closer to the north, Devon Avenue for Pakistani/Indian fare and shopping.  Due east is Lake Michigan with the CTA Red Line running constantly to downtown through many fun areas along the way: Uptown, Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Lincoln Park.  It's a 10-minute bus or taxi ride through a mostly residential area to the Red Line station in bustling Edgewater.  You can also pick up a Divvy bike at the Target 1/2 block from the house and ride to the nearest CTA Red Line station (Bryn Mawr) docking the bike near there.  Walking to the Red Line takes about 20 minutes.  Suburban Chicago is a short drive away -- Lincolnwood and Skokie to the west and Evanston to the north.
access: The master suite, study and storage areas are off-limits to guests except where accommodations have been pointed out specifically (such as a drawer and portion of the clothes closet in the guest room).
interaction: The guest accommodation is very much in the flow of the household, so we expect to interact with guests in passing, sometimes engaging in longer exchanges about the guest's Chicago experience or even further into topical discussions.  We have a history of socializing with guests who happen to enjoy our company as new friends, but basic pleasantries would be all that's expected.  Guests are free to greet and go, but it becomes less amiable if the home is treated like a hotel or commercial guesthouse.  While Roxane has worked in hotels and could see a more transactional experience as possible, Michael regards people staying as house guests and responds to Rox's hospitality cues by being genuinely open, warm and welcoming.  He is naturally curious and is exuberant when hosting, eager to hear of your Chicago experiences day by day as well as your work or creative life back home.
house_rules: No smoking; no drugs; no overnight guests; no use of owner's personal properties, amenities or consumables not mentioned in the agreement or obviously set aside for guest use; No animals. KITCHEN: We like to offer guests a spotless kitchen to feel free messing up.  We want to enter the kitchen with the same luxury greeting us.   Clean-up is 100% the guest's responsibility when using countertops, appliances, cookware, cutting boards, dining table.  That includes interiors of appliances that get spattered.  Surface cleaner, sponge, dishwashing liquid, abrasive powder and paper towels are on display for ease of use.   See detailed explanation elsewhere in this profile, or just forego using the kitchen at all.  If helpful, take a picture of the stovetop before use and model that level of clean. Host will clean kitchen sink before and after each guest stay, and host also empties dishwasher.  Guests load their own dishes into the dishwasher unless there's a clean load inside.  When dishes in
host_about: Performer/Professor/Journalist/Former Chicago Concierge from New Orleans living in Chicago for 30 years.  Lived in France and the Middle East.  (Tried several different profile pictures that weren't uploading, then discovered they ALL uploaded. Now there's an album in there! And I look like I live with a drink in my hand!  I do have fun.  But can't drink much!) Husband Michael is a legal analyst.

name: Huge private br in Wicker/Ukranian
summary: Really big master suite in lovely wicker park 2-level condo. Surrounded by the best food and attractions in the city, 7 minutes walking to the blue line, 20 minutes by train/bus to anything in the city. Perf for festivals, Lolla, Riotfest, Pitchfork
space: Walk Score 94! Huge private bedroom/bathroom suite in our very large Wicker Park condo. 14' high ceilings and queen sized bed, private bathroom, closet for storage. Wifi, Apple TV and the like provided. Located in the middle of Wicker Park's best attractions, bus/rail, and dining.  We're a late-20s working professional couple with two awesome babies and a great condo in Chicago's best hood. We're always game for hosting new and great people and would very much like to hear from you! Wicker Park is hands down the best place in Chicago for foodies, plus we've got great access to the cities many culinary attractions. Our next door neighbor is an Italian cafe frequently referred to as having 'one of Chicago's best patios'. The lakefront/Lincoln Park/Gold Coast/Mag Mile is 10-20 minutes by bus depending on the time and day you are going. Our house is an 8 minute walk from two blue line stops to get you to/from O'hare and Downtown quickly. If going to Midway add a transfer to the Orange line

neighborhood_overview: They call Brooklyn the Wicker Park of the East :P - We love our hood, it's full of energy, great food, art, cafes bars and just minutes from downtown and the lakefront or any other great Chicago attraction (Wrigley field!)
transit: There's a bus stop on the street in front of our house. We also have bike-share on our block (Divvy) and are about 7 mins walking to the Damen or Division CTA Blue Line stops which connect downtown and to the airports.
access: Private bed and bath, kitchen and dining area (we love group meals!), baby gear (stroller, toys, changing table, port-a-crib), your own set of keys to come and go as you please, AppleTV, outdoor patios, Laundry, car rental (Zipcar), bike share (Divvy), transit/CTA and plenty of street parking
interaction: Up to them, but we love hosting folks and often find time to share a meal and maybe a movie. Usually if we're doing events around town we'll invite guests or even just for coffee/drinks with friends. One lucky couple got to go sailing with us :O
house_rules: We don't have many 'rules' but I do provide a very detailed guide that explains getting to the house, entry, kitchen, cleanup, et cetera kinds of things you might like to know. Our only request is that you respect the quiet times for the babies and treat them as you would your own. Thanks!
host_about: Chicago, Startup Founder. Father of 2. Quiet, active, respectful and clean. Reading/writing most of my waking hours. Oh, serious foodie also.

name: 2 BD Condo by downtown,park,lake
summary: Awesome location, amazingly clean, below pricing for the area. You will not want to spend time in the apartment when you are so close to Chicago's famous sights, dining, and nightlife.
space: This is an extremely clean 2 Bedroom condo with a quiet courtyard to relax in. We are close to Downtown shopping, Lincoln Park, and North Ave beach. You can walk to public transportation and restaurants. It is minutes to Chicago's famous Rush street, Magnificent Mile, and Lincoln Park Zoo. It is a favorite of young professionals. For those with a car, the Interstate is less than a mile away. Travel times to the airports are 20 minutes for Midway and 35 minutes O'Hare. Allow extra time for rush hour. There are two bedrooms each with a comfortable Queen bed, a living room with fireplace, cable TV, and wireless Internet, a dining room, and a fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, stove, dishwasher, microwave, toaster oven, cooking utensils, and dishes). Every room has individual heater and air conditioning units. Added building amenities include indoor parking at $20/day (arranged with the building through the host separately from your Airbnb reservation), a laundry room with washers and d
