neighborhood_overview: This is a very active neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, shopping, night life, and places to visit. All are within walking distance or a short ride by public transportation.
notes: The building does not have an elevator. The condo is 2 flights of stairs from street level.
transit: The subway and bus stops are 1 to 2  blocks away. Taxi cabs can be flagged down at all times.
interaction: I personally meet every guest on check-in to make sure the accommodations are to your expectations and to answer questions. I am also available throughout your stay by phone, email, text, and Airbnb.
house_rules: We have very few but common sense rules. (1) Check-In is at 4:00 PM and Check-Out is no later than 11:00 AM. Since I personally meet you for check in, please make arrangements if you cannot coordinate with those times. (2) This is a NO SMOKING building. The condo owners are fined $50 if they or their guests smoke anywhere in the building (common areas or apartments). The fine, of course, will be passed on to you. $50 WILL BE TAKEN FROM YOU SECURITY DEPOSIT if you smoke in the condo or the building. (3) Be considerate of your neighbors in the building such as no late night blaring music. (4) Clean up after yourself in common areas as well as in the apartment. (5) I do not allow pets in the condo unless it is a service dog. (6) Take advantage of our wonderful city!
host_about:
For exercise I run Marathons, Ski, and Scuba. For business, I buy and sell Real Estate. For music, I totally enjoy Bruce Springsteen.
I value family and friends to the highest degree. As a Rotarian, community service is very important. I serve as a Board member of Arc of Hope, a Board member of Evanston Lighthouse Rotary, and a member of the Skokie Chamber of Commerce

name: Your Sweet Chicago Home
summary: 6 BR home in Lincoln Park, big enough to host your large group of friends and family!
space: Take a look at our big, comfortable, 6 bedroom home for you and your family. With its large dining room table and brand new kitchen, it is perfect for your get together. Please note: there is a three night minimum stay at the listed rate. One block from Halsted St. and all that the Lincoln Park neighborhood in Chicago has to offer, this 6 bedroom duplex apartment has a full kitchen, dining and living room plus additional rooms in which to spread out. A covered back porch (with table, chairs and a grill) leads to a parking area with room for up to 2 cars. The front yard has a gated seating area that looks out on a quiet residential street covered with beautiful homes and rich foliage. There is a piano as well as a working fireplace within the living room area, as well as cable television and wireless internet. This is a lovingly lived-in and well-maintained vintage family home in a great neighborhood, which will provide you with all the comforts of home. (Did we mention the spice rack?)

name: Off the Beaten Path on Harding Ave
space: Super nice and spacious apartment in up coming Humboldt Park. Just north is Logan Square and a walk to Humboldt Park.  This place is 1/2 block from CTA bus 53 which will connect you to the Blue line train that takes you to ORD in about an hour.  CTA bus 66 is 1 block away, which will take you to the center of it all,..etc; John Hancock building, Millenium Park, The Bean, Museums, Sears Tower.   3 Queens size beds each in there own bedroom.  Also, a twin size fold out couch and one regular sofa.    Free parking on the street, just pay attention to the signs!

Cool trip I've been on was to (Website hidden by Airbnb) many stories to tell,...

name: Large Private 3 Bedroom Apartment
summary: Spacious, airy, vintage 3 bedroom Chicago apartment
space: The first level of the building is a completely separate, totally private, 3 bedroom apartment!   Our home was built in 1904 and has a lot of character and charm!  While we continue to make improvements, the apartment is sparsely decorated and could use some updates, and is priced to reflect that.  We have queen sized beds in all three bedrooms. For groups with more than 6 guests, the two cozy couches can also be utilized. For groups with 8-10 guests, we have hideaway beds/cots that can also be prepared.  With notice, we may be able to provide your group with a pack and play when traveling with children. The kitchen is HUGE and stocked with all the appliances you'll need for storing food and cooking in the home. There is a large grocery store a block away for you to independently pick up food items for your group.  Complimentary wireless internet, Roku TV, and laundry in the basement is available for our guests.  We have enough linens to accommodate 10 guests comfortably. For large gro

neighborhood_overview: West Town is a vibrant and fun urban neighborhood, tons of diversity, and lots to see and do. We're within walking distance to great shops, vintage stores, parks, cafes, and bars. We're conveniently located adjacent to Wicker Park, Humboldt Park, Logan Square and Ukrainian Village-- all are walking distance away (under 1 mile).
notes: Listing photographs may not be 100% accurate, we are regularly updating furnishings, linens, decorations, and appliances in the apartments. There are people living in a unit above and you may hear overhead noise at times.  Be aware of this before booking and take precautions if a very light sleeper.
transit: Easily accessible to downtown via public transportation!  We are within walking distance of the CTA BLUE LINE.  The California, Western, and Damen blue line stops are all within 1 mile. They can be more quickly reached using the 70, 72, 52, or 49 bus routes. Pubic transportation via the BLUE LINE is easy to catch to get downtown or to O'Hare Airport in under 30 minutes, 24 hours/day.  Uber, a low-cost taxi alternative, has a large presence in Chicago.  If you are a first-time user of the app, use the promo code laurak4434ue for $15 free credit There is plentiful FREE parking available on our street (no permit required), and a divvy citywide bike rental station located a few blocks away
access: Everything the apartment has to offer. 3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, large kitchen, cable television, wifi, free washer and dryer, free street parking. The apartment has a back porch and pantry used for storage and supplies-- these are not intended to be guest areas.
interaction: Please reach out anytime over the Airbnb app if you need anything!
house_rules: Pets are only allowed with advanced notice and for an additional fee Special events can only be held with advanced notice for an additional fee.  Without prior permission, only the number of guests registered for the reservation are allowed in the building. We are not interested in hosting house parties for Chicagians. When booking our apartment, please make yourselves completely at home! Throughout your stay, please let us know if anything does not meet your expectations—we want to ensure that you have a wonderful experience staying in our home! During your stay, please: • Do not bring additional guests beyond the number in your reservation without permission from the host. • Alert us to any concerns about the condition, cleanliness, or functionality of the apartment. • Be courteous of people staying in other apartments in the building.  Remove heavy shoes to reduce overhead noise, keep music at reasonable levels. • Understand that no special events/parties/or additional guests should
host_about:
We're a married couple and parents to three children. We are originally from Michigan and now rent out our 3-flat in Chicago and also our former family home in nearby Blue Island, IL, and our coach house in our new town--Flossmoor. 

We're seasoned airbnb hosts and former couchsurfers

Laura's a Nurse Practitioner/Midwife.  Jeremy repairs glass, climbs mountains, and takes beautiful pictures.

We enjoy travel, cooking, beer, walks around the city, and exploring the nooks and crannies of our neighborhood. 

We love hosting people and have traveled in the same manner extensively. For our honeymoon, we couch-surfed across 5 countries in 3 weeks and now that we have young children, we appreciate the comfort and convenience of staying in local airbnb homes.

We believe that staying with a local host in a local neighborhood can add an incredible amount to your experience in a new city and love to offer our guests that adventure.

We pride ourselves in offering excellent value and service to our guests

name: Close to Chicago music Fest! (Students discount)
summary: Our place is your home away from home! Our neighborhood is great, conveniently located and we pride ourselves in being the best hosts possible by providing you with all the information you need to make your stay in Chicago great. See full description
space: Quaint neighborhood right outside of busy downtown close to the United center, with lounges and bars within walking distance. Directly down the street from Navy Pier on Grand Ave. A few blocks from Harpo studios Bottom Lounge music venue. Free wifi, and a rare find in Chicago - free street parking!(when available, which is usually often.) notes: CHECK IN TIME AFTER 8pm will be an additional  $20!! We also have two beautiful lizards that are harmless

interaction: If you have any questions or concerns about anything please give me a call (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
house_rules: We expect others to be clean and respectful. Common sense stuff. Know check in, check out times and read through listing completely so there is no confusion and additional fees aren't incurred.
host_about: Hi everyone!  Tracy and Josue here. :) We've been living in Chicago for quite some time now. Beautiful city to travel to! A little bit about us. I (Tracy) used to be a photographer but decided to change careers and become a Mortician.  Josue is a Socialite, Traveller, Humanitarian, Activist, Producer and Investor. We love everything we do and hosting for Airbnb is definitely one of them.  When our guests are happy we are happy. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable and amazing as possible. Josue is great with directions, places to check out, things to do, events and nightlife. He knows how to make an awesome drink as well! I love to cook and try new recipes. We both like to go out and experience nightlife, love being foodies and trying out new restaurants when the time permits. Love to travel as well, but Chicago is our Home for now! We are happy to share the experience!

space: Located in a classic Lakeview building, this new redecorated studio is larger than most in the neighborhood and has space for a sleeping area and living area in the main space.  There is a separate kitchen space to cook and enjoy meals in as well.

notes: - High quality wifi perfect for work or leisure - Apple TV with Netflix for 10,000+ titles to stream - Queen Size Alexander Nest Bedding Mattress - Iron and ironing board - Hair dryer

name: Logan Square-Chicago Prime Location-Longer Stays
summary: This is a house size apartment in a prime location in Logan Square, spacious and nicely furnished with just what you need, no more.  Families and travelers from around the world have stayed here.  Available for longer stays (min one month) in 2018.  The den can be converted to a bedroom, we have hosted groups up to six people.  Very convenient for travelers, short walk to Blue Line Train (O'Hare and Downtown).  Our unit is ready to move in and enjoy Chicago.  Great for families.
space: Logan Square is a "hot" neighborhood in Chicago - lots of young people, new business and entertainment, excellent transportation central to CTA train, major highways, bike routes, and airport.  This apartment is ideal for a couple or family, short term stay or transition move.  Our unit is on one of the nicest blocks, with quiet "residential neighborhood" vibe but very short walk to cool coffee shops, boutique grocers and wine shop, top notch restaurants including Longman and Eagle, Buona Terra, Quiote, Lula Cafe, bars, farmers market, and train to downtown.  It is a first floor unit in a classic Chicago Greystone with spacious living and dining rooms, den/office, entry way, two bedrooms, and spare closets.  Master bedroom has large closet, back bedroom is comfortable but no closet. Kitchen is modern style with good lighting, morning sun, marble "look" island, wood cabinets, and modern appliances, well equipped for people who like to cook. description: This is a house size apartment in a prime location in Logan Square, spacious and nicely furnished with just what you need, no more.  Families and travelers from around the world have stayed here.  Available for longer stays (min one month) in 2018.  The den can be converted to a bedroom, we have hosted groups up to six people.  Very convenient for travelers, short walk to Blue Line Train (O'Hare and Downtown).  Our unit is ready to move in and enjoy Chicago.  Great for families. Logan Square is a "hot" neighborhood in Chicago - lots of young people, new business and entertainment, excellent transportation central to CTA train, major highways, bike routes, and airport.  This apartment is ideal for a couple or family, short term stay or transition move. neighborhood_overview: Spacious but bustling urban neighborhood in a great city.  Surprisingly easy to park.  There are city rental bikes ("Divvy" bikes) only a half block away on Altgeld, next to Quiote Restaurant.  Its a three block walk to the train, and we are less than half mile from a second train stop as well.
transit: Ideal for location and transportation.  Car:  about three blocks from Interstate 90/94. Train:  close to two Blue Line stops.   Bike:  lots of dedicated bike lanes, lots of bicyclists, about 25 minutes to downtown.   On foot:  Great neighborhood for walking and running.   Plane:  short trip to O'Hare airport.  Neighborhood is very convenient for travelers.
access: Parking (and free 24 hour passes), CTA train, walking to many places and amenities.  Laundry (free) in basement.
interaction: As little or much as required to make sure everything is OK.
house_rules: Please inquire for complete house rules list on cancellations, etc.  We have a two night minimum. Great for couple or two couples, big enough for a family of 4, 5 or 6.  Nice place for entertaining, or as home base for exploring Logan Square (but no loud parties please).   We may consider a pet if it is a transition in housing.
host_about: We live in the residence with our two preteen children. The neighborhood is bustling. Eat and drink at any of  several excellent establishments just a few steps away. We love our neighborhood and you will too.
